Review.review: I remember seeing these as a kid on my friend and some adults and thought to try them, I was a fan of Adidas as I loved the originals sneakers collection and one of my teachers had spoke about how the shoe felt like indoor cleats, I thought to finally try them.A great pair of shoes especially for the money, I probably wore these shoes over a thousand times too, to the point where there were holes and I had to get rid of them a few weeks ago. My first reaction when I got the shoes was that they were very light, at first you kind of have to break them in. They may seem a bit snug and may hurt a little bit. Perhaps it hurted me more than others because I have flat feet. After a week when you break them in, they sort of shape to your feet. It will feel comfortable and you'll feel as light as a feather, the shoes are great for athletics and they are very aesthetically pleasing, more so I liked how the shoe was rather versatile. If I wanted to wear some chinos, or some casual wear it wouldn't look to bad infact it would play the part. what I absolutely loved about these sneakers is how you can simply slip them on, I always hated those sneakers that you had to untie and worry about the shoe getting creases and what not. I however found that after a while, the shoe felt like it was slipping off and that it may have expanded during the time I was wearing, again nothing too big but it felt like it grew about 1/2 over the time I had it.  This became my go to shoe whenever I was leaving, I didn't even dare look at the others as my feet had gone through so much uncomfort when I went back. The shoe can get rather slippery in the winter and on wet areas so you need to be careful there but it's not like they're meant to be used during the winter. One of the things that I disliked about the shoe is how I had to keep on tying the laces several times, perhaps this had to with the laces mainly but I felt like it was the shoe moving from place to place as it started to expand and stretch. During the shoes last dying dies, I start to get holes from the ongoing times I've worn it, I knew it wouldn't last the way I treated it but for $40+ I didn't very much care. I later discovered that the inside of the shoes is composed of mainly some kind of cardboard, kind of surprising how such a comfortable fit could be made from such cheap material.I would recommend these to a friend, perhaps you may not want to wear them as much as I did however if you plan on making them last but it's great and with a price like that. You can't really go wrong. Would I buy them again however, there are many other shoes in the market and I'm willing to try many and see where they take me but I will have flashbacks of all the events that I had with my pair of shoes. I never begun to adore a shoe like that, no matter how much damage and dirt and stretching it went through, it managed and still had an amazing authentic look.

TL;DR: Great shoes, will mold to fit you like a glove, and last for at least a year of heavy use. Get the Samba Originals if you prefer a short tongue.About me: I'm on my fourth pair of Samba Classics. In a row. I love this shoe, and I think you will too. That being said, here's what I think you need to know:I first started wearing these shoes because I needed something with a flat sole to dance in (I did musicals in high school, and I wore straight through a pair of running shoes), and I fell completely in love with them. I wear them 100% of the time when it isn't raining and there isn't snow on the ground. I have also worn them for their "intended purpose" - indoor soccer - and find they work great there too.I would DEFINITELY recommend these shoes for serious walking, dancing, or indoor soccer. NOTE WELL: they will mold to your feet as if you were born wearing them, and will change their appearance somewhat once broken in (the leather will look a lot less shiny, and will develop a flatter fit across your foot), in my opinion much for the better. Like all leather shoes, these have a break in period, and I find it's less than a week. Once broken in, they feel AWESOME, and last a very long time: my last three pairs lasted between 1 year and 1.5 years each, depending on the amount of walking I did (walking increased when I went to college). They're also very comfortable walking / standing shoes. I've never gotten blisters or pains from them.I would NOT recommend these shoes for rain, snow, ice, hiking, or serious running. The flat sole, which makes them great for traction on flat, dry surfaces, falls short on all of these things. Since they are leather, they're fairly water resistant, and a coat of water repellent spray will make them very water resistant (and avoid winter salt water stains), but water WILL get in around the tongue, which is not attached at the sides, only at the front.These shoes tend to wear in two places: the interior heel (the back of the inside lining), which will develop holes if you're a fan of slipping your shoes on and off (which I don't recommend: these are leather, they're meant to be tied snug); and the sole, which will gradually wear toward smooth. I find that the sole and the upper wear at about the same rate: i.e. by the time the sole is worn to the point of noticeable slippage on wet surfaces, the shoes themselves look like they're ready to be replaced. If you don't care about these two factors (or you want a pair of old shoes to work in), they will basically last forever. I still use my first pair for construction, painting, and mowing the lawn. They're over four years old and the leather will probably outlast everything else in my life.These shoes are essentially identical to the Samba Originals, the difference being that these have a longer tongue. Some people don't like the tongue, which is reminiscent of soccer cleats, but I like it because it makes the shoes pop a bit more, and goes well with long casual pants, with which you can wear the tongue outside of the pants (the tongue is also not uncomfortable with shorts, especially after it gets bent forward a bit by being worn with long pants).

title: adidas Women's Ultraboost 22 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and supportive, with great arch support and no foot aches or blisters. They appreciate the shoes' quality, appearance, and value for money, with one customer noting they're excellent for both daily runs and longer distances. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some say they fit great, others find them too tight for average feet.

Review.review: Key FeaturesBoost Midsole: Provides exceptional energy return and cushioning.Primeknit Upper: Offers a snug, sock-like fit for maximum comfort.Stretchweb Outsole: Adapts to the runner's stride for a smooth ride.Torsion System: Ensures stability and flexibility during runs.Eco-Friendly: Made with Primeblue, a high-performance recycled material.ProsComfort: The Boost midsole delivers superior cushioning and energy return.Fit: Primeknit upper offers a flexible, snug fit.Stability: Torsion system enhances stability and support.Durability: High-quality materials ensure long-lasting performance.Eco-Conscious: Made with sustainable materials.ConsPrice: Higher price point compared to other running shoes.Weight: Slightly heavier than some ultra-light running shoes.Break-In Period: May require a few runs to fully break in.Personal ExperienceThe Adidas Women's Ultraboost 22 has proven to be an excellent choice for both daily runs and longer distances. The Boost midsole provides outstanding cushioning, making each step feel energized and comfortable. The Primeknit upper fits like a glove, reducing the risk of blisters and providing excellent breathability.The shoe's stability is impressive, thanks to the Torsion system, which supports the foot without compromising flexibility. The Stretchweb outsole adapts well to my stride, offering a smooth and responsive ride.While the shoes are slightly heavier than some other running models, the comfort and support they provide outweigh this minor drawback. The eco-friendly aspect is a bonus, aligning with my values of sustainability.ConclusionThe Adidas Women's Ultraboost 22 Running Shoe is a top-tier choice for runners seeking comfort, support, and performance. Despite its higher price and slight weight, the benefits of superior cushioning, stability, and eco-conscious design make it a worthwhile investment for serious runners.

title: Under Armour Men's Charged Assert 9 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-designed, and lightweight, offering good value for money. They appreciate the fit, with one customer noting they're available in wide sizes. The durability receives mixed feedback - while some say they're holding up great, others report they wear down quickly. The sizing is also mixed, with some finding them true to size while others say they run small.

Review.review: Honestly one of the best shoes on the market for wide foot people, if your looking to snag a simple set of running sneakers, in my opinion. Here's some in-depth info along with  pro's and con's:TLDR: Great quality shoes for the price, and easy to clean. Recommend to beginner and intermediate runners/hikers, experts may be willing to pay more money for increase of quality.PROs:- Perfect Fit. I usually wear 9.0 wide (USA), so that is what I ordered and it fit perfectly.- Comfort and Ease. I like how comfortable they are and they are easy to slip on and off (if you wish) by the use of the heel pull tab. The tab also prevents the heel from getting bunched in or broken when putting on the shoes, which was a frequent problem with some other brands I have owned in the past.- Easy to Clean, Quality Mesh. I have seen some reviews saying these shoes wear out easily or the mesh is easier to damage. YMMV but I didn't seem to have this issue and I've had these shoes for about a year. IMO I find the mesh to be much more durable than the cloth mesh most sports shoes have these days and much easier to clean, which is essential for anyone like myself, who often hikes or runs in forestry/mud.- Above Average Quality. As for the year timeframe, the 1st set was about 8 months of extreme use, then I purchased a 2nd pair which I've had for about 3 months now. This may seem like a short timeframe to some but for me, I usually have to change shoes every 6 months or less if they are lower quality because they get a lot of mileage and use. I still have the 1st set which I use as "lawn mowing shoes", as they are still usable but the tread does not get much grip/traction anymore for running. I liked them enough to buy that 2nd pair instead of some other brand/model.- Decent Arch Support and Sole Tread. You will find other shoes with the same or better, but I didn't see many that were this cheap in price.- Part of Amazon's "Try Before You Buy". Free try-ons. You can take up to 6 days to decide whether to keep/return if you wish, and only be charged if not returned by the 7th day. Day 1 is the day they are delivered.- Uniform in Color. The shoe currently comes in all-black or all-white, including the logo. YMMV but this is a pro for me due to work restrictions requiring all-black shoes, so I can also wear them leisurely at work if I choose (I'm a mechanic). Great for anyone with the same issue, or military, etc.CONs:- Not the most expert/elite quality shoe out there, but will definitely check most people's boxes for average needs, imo.- Cost is higher than one might desire for just simple leisure shoes. But as an avid runner, the price is about average. However, they are usually on sale. My 1st set was around 40% off which dropped it from $70-something to $43, which was worth it for me. 2nd set was about 20% off. Winter holiday seems to be the best time for sales price.- Tread pattern is smooth and circular, instead of rigid and square/triangle, in case that matters to you (in regards to rock climbing etc)Overall I was surprisingly satisfied with this shoe model personally, but your mileage may vary.

The shoe was just slightly snug in a size 14. Could have used just a bit more arch support for my liking, but these were my mistakes, not being able to try before buying. Other than that, the shoes are light and comfortable, and they feel very solid. For the price, I would definitely buy again.
Husband lobes the fit. Comfortable.  Wears them to work every day.

While the insoles of the Brooks are more cushioned,the width of these won out for overall comfort. These are sized more in line with my typical experience of shoe sizing. I ordered multiple Brooks to try on and none was a truly good fit.I'm going to be doing a lot of walking, so I may purchase an additional insert but for everyday wear they are more than adequate without an insert.I'm happy to find a new brand, that has a dependable sizing system.Shoe quality:The quality appears to be goodArch support:arch support is goodMaterial thickness:SubstantialColor:blackSlip resistance:hopefully good I haven't been able to test drive in wet surfaces yetLightweight:yes, lightweight

title: adidas Women's Eq21 Running Shoe, 6 AU
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one mentioning they can wear them all day without pain, and appreciate their great quality, nice colors, and good value for money. The fit receives mixed feedback - while some find them roomy around the toes, others note they run very narrow. The support and durability also get mixed reviews, with some praising the arch support while others find it lacking, and while some say they hold up well to elements, others report issues with laces ripping through holes.

Review.review: Love, Love my Adidas sneakers! I broke a few toes 2 years ago and since then the toe area is too tight and hurts to walk, and I have very narrow feet so finding shoes are hard....most shoes that said wide toe box, the shoe itself was wide also. My daughter mentioned she wears Adidas and they are pretty roomy in the toe area. I read the reviews and someone else had mention this. So I bought a pair and they are like a dream on my feet! This pair is my second pair. I am able to walk long distances, stand on my feet in one place for hours, and ride my bike without hurting. Durable and Great Support all over. I purchased black and pink which are perfect for where I work as they wipe off easily. I haven't washed them yet, but I feel like they would withstand a trip in the washer. Only issue I have with them is where the tongue attaches to the area at the top of the laces (closest to the toes), I have to shove my finger in to smooth it out before tying or it's uncomfortable. Otherwise, these are my go to shoes going forward!
These are my favorite shoes. Love the fit, the color and comfort. I have used for walking and the gym.

So I ordered these on August 27th 2024, and it is now June 19th 2025, and they have finally started breaking down and causing problems for my feet. I wore them almost every day, and as a college student, there can be a lot of walking all over campus. These shoes have been great, and the fact that they last around 10 months, when you should probably replace them every 6-ish months, shows how great a shoe it is. I love them and plan to order them again soon. I 100% recommend them.Something I should add is that these were everyday shoes for me. I wore them to school, work, and just going on simple walks, etc. I am not a runner or jogger, and I can't really attest to how these are as "workout" shoes.
These Adidas sneakers are super comfortable and stylish. I can walk in them all day without any pain. Good quality and perfect fit!
Very comfortable and I got it in a good price. I have had it for 2 years and it shows very good quality
It runs about a half size larger than what you usually wear.Love the shoe just too large
Cute shoe. Good suppport. Comfortable. Lightweight. Easy for walking.

title: adidas Women's Advantage Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes aesthetically pleasing and appreciate their lightweight design. The fit receives mixed feedback from customers.

Review.review: No era numero perfecto😅
This is a light and comfortable shoe!
Awesome fit perfect

The sneaker itself is exactly as you’d expect, aesthetically speaking. HOWEVER, the INSOLE is unacceptable. How’re you going to advertise how comfortable your sneakers are but then fail to provide the insert that is assumed to be the source of the advertised comfort?The stitching (for my personal foot) ran under my 4th toe, meaning that my pinky toe technically wasn’t on the traced insert. The stitching used is obviously good quality, but is usually only seen if you lift the insert of the sneaker. But as stated before, there is no insert (imo) so now I’m expected to buy an additional product to accommodate what I thought would naturally just be a part of a sneaker to be purchased by me, the consumer. I did not realize that the cloud comfort foam is not meant to be directly felt by my feet, but rather an insert that is not included with the sneakers themselves, and must be purchased individually (that doesn’t even consider that “the right insert” might be hard to find for any multitude of reasons $).

The shoes are lightweight and look like the picture. My issue is the inner lining is weird near the toes. It’s like there is no padding under the toes. Honestly, it feels like these didn’t pass the quality assurance test to be “real” adidas.
I don't use these for working out, but they're good for everyday wear.
This is our 2nd pair and both pair have made a popping noise when walking. Look cute and fit like expected but overall disappointing

I got these shoes for walking, jogging, and working out. I hadn’t planned to use them for running races or anything intense, but expected them to be more supportive than they are. They showed up without a shoebox, which I found odd, and although I like my workout shoes to be lightweight, these feel like the inside of a shoe, rather than a full shoe (thin, not durable, cheaply made). I can feel the ground under my foot when I walk, and it is no where close to what I would imagine walking on a cloud, like the name would lead you to believe, to be. I’m wondering if these were actually made by Adidas or if I got scammed as I have never had this poor of quality Adidas in my whole life. Disappointed.

This is his most recent size up when he turned 5. He picked these because he liked the design and thought it looked cool.  Has enjoyed wearing them and has put them through a lot of mud, dirt, and play. His toes are at the tip now so it's time to size up again. I washed them so they look new again. We will pass these to a younger family member. Yay for adidas.

title: adidas Originals Women's Terrex Tracefinder Trail Running Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these trail running shoes comfortable with no blisters and appreciate their durability, with one customer noting they held up through 15K of mud. The shoes offer good grip on gravelly trails and no slipping issues during tours, while also receiving positive feedback for their style and accurate sizing. The arch support receives mixed reviews, with some customers finding it supportive for long days.

Review.review: Why did you pick this product vs others?:I chose these specifically for a Tough Mudder 15K. I needed something lightweight, trail-ready, and supportive enough for hours of running, climbing, and wading through deep mud — and they delivered big time.I absolutely adore these shoes. They held up through 15K of mud, water, obstacles, and nonstop movement. I was knee-deep in 2.5 feet of mud for much of the race, and not once did they slip, rub, or make my feet ache. The tread was fantastic for trail grip, and the arch support was just as good as what I get from my Danskos or Brooks — which I wear daily at my hospital job where I’m on my feet for 8+ hours.These didn’t just survive the course — they thrived on it. No blisters, no soreness, and they cleaned up surprisingly well post-race. Highly recommend for anyone doing obstacle races, trail runs, or just needing a solid, supportive shoe for long days.

Really comfortable walking/hiking (simple hiking), shoes. Nice they can be thrown in the washing machine and not fall apart. They dry quickly, very important, grip the ground well, and cleaning the bottoms off isn’t too bad. The arch support is a little weak, but it’s difficult to generally fit everyone’s feet. I’d say they’ve been a great value for my money as I have walked in them for many miles, and the tread, fabric, and laces are still like new.
lived these but they ran big. I had to return it

They got a little dusty, but they still look brand new.
Comfy, larger toe box so you can wear thick socks if needed. Cute and lightweight. Good support.

Review.review: I love these shoes. I ordered them in several colors. I like the look and they are extremely comfortable. I wear them every day and as walking shoes. My feet never hurt no matter how much I walk. Like others have said, they run large. I went down half a size and they fit perfectly.

I was looking really quick for something to match my hoodie and arrive a few days before leaving on a flight. I searched for a few brands and wallah! My normal size in womens run 6.5-7 so I quickly purchased the 7. Then realized I didn't do my due diligence per usual and ran to the reviews for sizing. Dang I had to cancel the 7 and order the size 6. Reviews mention the shoe runs really big and to size down 1 or 1.5 sizes. The 5.5 was not available would have actually been perfect. The saving grace is that this shoe is not wide, so the narrow fitting allows me to wear with a bit more room in the toe.  But the 6 works just as well for the timing, fit. and the color match is spot on!!!
Cute and comfortable!

First of all, I love the simple style and beige color of these sneakers. They’re comfy but I still prefer to exchange the insoles for others anyway. Now for the weird part: I was surprised to read all the comments saying how big these shoes run, but they are definitely a full size too big. I wear a 9 and sometimes 9.5, and I had to go down to an 8 and they fit perfectly. Strangely, the tag says the size US 8 is equivalent to size EU/FR 40 (which is actually a 9) and it seems that the true sizing aligns with the EU size that is listed on the tag rather than the US size.

The design and color looked very elegant and stylish to me and I ordered the size reading customer reviews.I usually wear 6.5 but I ordered the size 6.5 (wide ) to keep some extra space and flexibility between my fingers for extra comfort. The shoe was perfect to my size. Had great experience wearing them for 3-4 days for long hours. It has very soft cushioning and soft rubber soul which made the shoe very comfortable to wear.I stood on my foot for hours with great comfort..Worth paying for it..Would recommend everyone to buy.

I don’t write many reviews, but sometimes you have to. The sizing of these shoes is a joke. I ordered my regular 9.5 size after carefully following Adidas’ guidance: place a piece of paper on the floor against the wall, mark where your big toe hits, and find your size on the chart. Cool.They arrived last week, and they looked and fit like clown shoes. I hate returning items — more trucks on the road, more cardboard waste — but the shoes looked great, and I needed a new pair. So, I ordered a full size down, even though I’ve never been an 8.5 in my life.They arrived today, and again, they’re huge! Length, width — even the laces are double the length they should be. Adidas really messed up with this one, and it’s not a cheap shoe either. I gave them 2 stars because they’re nice-looking, but they’re completely useless.
I returned these. They seemed too big and clunky looking, but I really wanted the retro look. The white sole stood out too much and was just big.

title: adidas Men's X_PLR Boost Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable, well-made, and stylish, with good cushioning and soft, flexible top fabric. They offer good value for money and run slightly large. Customers disagree on the shoes' weight, with some finding them lightweight while others consider them heavy for running.

Review.review: COZY. PERIOD. I have a club foot and don't like custom made sketchers they are big and odd and cost $500+ Adidas foam shoes changed my life, these are affordable compared to ultra boost and give you height in the back, color is great and these are slightly heavier than ultra boost but they are slightly taller in the back and less squeaky on smooth surfaces (non continental rubber, but they last a long time with support). They are cool inside not as cool as the sport fabric ultra boost but these repel water better, great work and trail shoes. These are my second pair you see them overseas in addidas stores and they are definitely a clean look.

My favorite shoes in the world, glad I can still buy them somewhere. Fit great, box was destroyed but who cares, shoes were brand new and fine. Will buy again, great price too, cheaper than stores. Boost foam is extremely comfortable and you can slip them right on easily if you wear them loose

My second pair of these. They are super squishy and soft. NOT a running or any kind of athletics shoe. There's essentially no structure and applying force to run or change directions will cause your foot to roll/move. Just a crazy level of cushion for casual wear and walking.

Compared to my Ultraboost 1.0 these shoes are HEAVY suckers. They’re comfortable with the boost technology but I bought the black / black as an everyday replacement to my white / white 1.0s but barely wear them because it feels like the transition from the 1.0s (which are basically weightless) to these is night and day.When I do wear them, I get used to the weight but there’s a stigma reaching for them in my closet because I regret buying such heavy shoes. I wish I’d paid more and got lighter shoes, period.  Got a decent deal on them though and I know they’ll last a long time, especially with how little I wear them.If it’s your first pair of boosts, I would highly recommend searching for a lighter shoe. The price tag may be higher but the shoe will last and not weigh your feet down like concrete blocks, figuratively speaking.

Yes they are expensive, unless you can catch them on sale, but they are worth it.  I've heard for years how great the bounce shoes are.  They are excellent; super comfortable.  They make you want to move.Mine are orange & they don't really match with any outfit, but everyone says they look great.

I liked these so much that I bought two pairs with different colors. These have some of the best padding that I have tried out of any shoe, which makes them super comfortable for walking around and if you are on your feet a lot! I found them to fit true to size, but if you really like a tight find you could go a half size down. I’m a 10 and I’ve tried 9.5s which fit too. You can run with these despite what many say, just be aware that they are heavy so they can sap your energy. Despite their weight and soft flexible top fabric, I have used them for many running sessions at the gym with no problem. By far my favorite everyday shoe that I have tried! I wouldn’t use these for fast sports like basketball. You would probably want a shoe with less padding for those activities.

These fit bigger than other adidas, but "normal" for other brands like New Balance. That out of the way, they are so comfortable. There's like a full inch of boost underfoot. That makes them a bit heavy for running, but great for casual use.
Best shoes I've ever had. So comfortable and these make you like 2 inches taller.

title: adidas Men's Terrex Free 2 Low Gtx Hiking Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these hiking shoes comfortable, well-made, and durable, with one customer noting they perform well on various terrains. They provide good support, with one review mentioning confidence on loose rocks and uneven surfaces, and offer great grip and traction. While some customers find them true to size, others report they run too big, and customers disagree on the weight.

Review.review: I am absolutely delighted with my new Adidas hiking shoes, which I purchased specifically for a recent hiking trip to Estes Park, Colorado. From the moment I laced them up, I knew these shoes were going to be a game-changer, and they certainly proved their worth on the challenging trails.My primary requirements for hiking footwear are comfort and support, and these Adidas shoes delivered outstandingly on both fronts. The cushioning provides excellent comfort, absorbing the impact of each step, while the robust construction offers superior ankle and arch support, which is crucial for long days on the trail. One small note on sizing: I found that the sizing was a bit off, and I actually had to size down to get the perfect fit.I put these shoes through an extensive test, hiking between 8 and 11 miles each day through the rugged and rocky terrain of Estes Park. Despite the demanding conditions, my feet remained comfortable and well-protected. There was no slipping, rubbing, or discomfort, even after many hours of continuous use. The grip on the soles was exceptional, providing confidence on loose rocks and uneven surfaces.These shoes truly stood up to the challenge, proving to be incredibly durable and reliable. They not only protected my feet from the harsh ground but also contributed significantly to my overall enjoyment and stamina during the hikes.Overall, if you're planning a hiking adventure, especially one involving rocky or demanding trails, I cannot recommend these Adidas hiking shoes highly enough. They offer a perfect blend of comfort, support, and durability, making them an indispensable companion for any serious hiker.

Per many other reviews these shoes run really large. I normally wear an eight or an 8 1/2 in hiking and running shoes. The first pair I bought were eights which I thought would be small enough. They were huge. I returned those for a 7 1/2. I have wide feet and even the 7 1/2 is a smidge large. I ran out of time for a trip and kept them instead of trying an even smaller size. I have plenty of room in the toe box. I can’t imagine these would work for anyone with narrow to maybe even moderately narrow feet. I also don’t have much arch. I wear Hoka Gaviotas- if you have those you’ll love these.  If you can find the right fit, these are very comfortable right out of the box and a great hiker. I hiked in Costa Rica in muddy and wet dirt and had zero issues. Grip and traction was great. There was no break-in needed-  no blisters or tired feet.  They cleaned up well. ( I do wish manufacturers would stop using white bottoms on hiking shoes. It’s a given you’ll be in brown dirt- why white?) I also wore these all day traveling and in airports. Seriously comfy shoe.  I wasn’t a fan of the green color in the 8.5 - they looked a little garish. I wish all manufacturers had more neutral, natural colors.  I went to black in the second pair and much preferred that look albeit they’re  a little boring. If you have feet like mine shoe shopping can be really frustrating. I went to REI and many other stores before giving up and going to Amazon. (Oddly I didn’t find Hoka hikers comfortable. Too much arch) I do think it’s worth trying to find the right size in these because in the end if you have wide flattish feet these are great for trails and even day to day. That’s why I gave them 5 stars.One note- the rear pull strap is quite high.  While it didn’t bother me a ton I can see how it might bother others.

These hiking shoes run larger than other brands, see my picture comparing them to several other brands I own that are the same size (size 8.) However, they are so comfy and my feet appreciated the extra room on my hike. My right foot typically can only stand a 45 minute hike before the ball of foot starts to throb and swell throbs. I took these out on a hour and 15 minute hike and only had mild pain. They performed very well on a variety of terrain. No slippage on sand, loose dirt, grass, or compact gravel, even in hills. There was minor slippage on loose rocksthat where about 1"-2" diameter when going downhill. The shoe also seemed to give my weak ankles more support. There was one point where I slipped slightly and felt my ankle wanted to turn, however the shoe prevented it. My old hiking shoes don't come up high enough on the ankle and my foot would have turned over for sure. If you're someone who has feet that ache and seem to swell when you hike, I would recommend sticking to your normal size. Otherwise you might want to size down. Personally, I'm glad they run a little big so my toes don't press against the shoe, which always seemed to happen when I'd walk down hills. My feet didn't seem to slide around in the extra room like I was worried they would either.

I like and wear a roomier size 8 in my Brooks running shoes but usually do a 7.5 in many other shoes. I bought the 7.5 for these after reading reviews about size. They were too big and I had to send back to get a 7. They are insanely comfortable and a perfect trail shoe when hiking boots are too much but tennis shoes aren’t quite enough. These are more comfortable than typical trail running shoes and are a bit heavier. They have as good as or better traction and grip than other similar shoes (way more than OnClouds and about the same as Altra). They have a wide toe box and thick sole padding. They’re a great hiking shoe or for walking off road or in mud and rain, as they’re waterproof. Love them! They do look a little bulky on, so if that bothers you, you may want to look elsewhere.

The light blue and orange shoes are not water proof . The other options that have Gor Tex labeled on the shoe are . The light blue are comfortable and true to size . I had to return mine due to them not being waterproof.

title: adidas Men's Ultrarun 5 Trail Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these trail sneakers comfortable and well-fitting, with accurate sizing. They appreciate the shoes' appearance and consider them suitable for active young adults, with one customer specifically mentioning they work well for running in mud.

Review.review: Fantastic shoes. I wore these over a 12day trip through Europe and my feet were comfortable all day walking on cobblestone streets, whether the weather was warm or cool and drizzling.

I am always hesitant to buy shoes online due to problems with sizing, but these seem to be sized accurately. I have three other pairs of Adidas running shoes, two of them being 11's and one being 10.5. I also measured my heel to toe length and got between 10.5 and 11 inches, depending on if I am putting any weight on my foot or not. Based on this, I thought buying size 11 would be a safe bet. Once I put them on, I noticed the fabric above my big toe was a little tight when wearing them with socks on the thicker side, but not too uncomfortable. This may change as the insoles wear in. I was expecting there to be more room width-wise due to reviews stating that the shoes were very wide, but I did not find this to be the case. They seem to be on par with my other shoes, and I don't own any 'wide' sized shoes, but YMMV. If you are going purely off of the size chart, I would probably order a half to full size larger, but you can always return them and get another size. Overall, I like the shoes and will be ordering another pair, in size 11.5 this time, for when these wear out one day.
Very nice for the price. I'm always concerned about width bc of my paddle feet, but these were true to size in length and very comfy in the width as well.  Now I'm just 'new shoe goofin''.

I wear size 13 and haven't had any problems with them being too short (that I recall) prior to these shoes. All of my toes were touching the front of the shoe when standing. Definitely not wide as some have mentioned here. Width seemed normal to a little tight. Otherwise looked like a decent shoe but nothing special.

We originally tried these Adidas UltraRun 5 Trail sneakers on in-store, but they didn’t have the right size. We ended up ordering them online, and my 12-year-old loves them! He says they feel super light, and that really helps with quicker movement and faster running. He wears them to school.  Great fit, great performance—highly recommend for active kids with almost adult feet ...haha.  I'm sure this product is good for adults - but speaking for my 12 yo that wears them.

I recently got these Adidas Astrastar sneakers, and I'm very happy with their blend of style and comfort. Right out of the box, the shoes felt well made and durable, just as I'd expect from Adidas as I've owned lots of their shoes in the past. The design is sleek and sporty, with a slightly chunky, late 90s styled silhouette.The Cloudfoam cushioning is awesome, it feels like walking on a cloud, and helps me to be on my feet all day. The insoles have great contours and provide excellent arch support, which makes them comfortable for all-day wear. I even wore them on a long vacation with a lot of walking, and my feet felt great with no blisters. The shoes are also very lightweight while still offering solid support.The fit is true to size, but I did notice that they are a bit wider in the toe box, which is actually a plus for me. The lace up design allows for a more secure fit. While the toe guard felt a bit stiff at first, it broke in quickly and didn't cause any issues.Overall, these shoes are a perfect balance between comfort, performance, and everyday style.

I have the White/Silver/Pink version, really love the Adidas women's Astrastar sneaker!It's not recommended to wear new shoes on a trip for the first time but I took these into the city for a few days showing relatives around and even though they were brand spanking new, they were super comfy, no blisters to mention! Very cute, and easily fits with many different outfits. We walked all day long, about 10 hrs each day. I was exhausted but my feet were happy!The outsole has nice curves to it, less impact but not too curvy like some sneakers are today. The little pink accent on the heel seems like a small detail but it makes it soooo cute! The fit was true to size. Good contours on the footbed, insole molds to your foot, I have high arches.  I love them!

Adidas is one of my favorite brands of shoes and clothing. I've always been able to count on them time and again to be well-made, with high quality fabrics and materials and this shoe is no different. They are lightweight, the insole is incredibly comfortable right out of the box. No break in time required. But for some reason, this style, the Astrastar is at least a half size to a full size larger than what I have always worn in an Adidas. I added some pics to compare to another Adidas I have that is also a size women's 9 1/2. So, though it's different for everybody, I would recommend sizing down in this style. All that being said, these shoes are more than worth the money.

These look great, with a classic and sharp silhouette and a clean minimal style. They are way more durable than Gazelles, but also slightly heavier. They felt a bit stiff initially, but after a break in period they cnform to the shape of your foot and wear like a glove. The leather is quality full grain that is subtly pebbled. They have a cushy EVA midsole and a rubber outsole that is more suited for urban wear than a typical soccer shoe, like the Samba. Arch support is good but not overdone. The Samoa's  are somewhat slept on in the Adidas Originals line, but are a fantastic shoe that pairs well with athletic or casual outfits and has clean, sleek lines. It's a touch more refined than a shelltoe and well built.  Great for walking and they stay comfortable all day. I am a size 12 with a slightly wide toe and these fit true to size.

Love these shoes so much, I bought them in navy from Foot Locker, too. I have planter fasciitis and arthritis from knee surgeries (I used to be athletic!). I can wear these shoes without issue all day. They even work great for business casual.

Review.review: This is a great looking running/lifestyle shoe, mainly for its silhouette from different views of point.Yes, it does run a bit long, but choosing one’s regular size would still do it without an issue.The upper seems built in three layers of synthetic materials, rendering a certain degree of richness, while eyelets islands seem to be of real leather, good for some contrast and to touch.The unique feature of this model Avryn, which I appreciate it very much, is the dual foams midsole, i.e. Boost + Bounce, or PU + EVA, each has their own characteristics, PU for good cushioning and longevity while EVA for bouncing. To put them together in a sensible way costs extra for sure, that’s a good value there.True, it doesn’t fit as snugly as most other shoes we see, but counting on so many good and unique features of Avryn, it is a good model to have.Mine is the White/Zero Metallic. It has basically four different shades of white, white, cream, beige and chalk white. I love the subtlety it presents.Overall, a great design, thumbs up!

title: adidas Men's Ultrabounce Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable and true to size, with amazing cushioning and a great look. They are particularly good for walking and exercise, and one customer mentions they're ideal for mowing and yard work. The durability receives mixed feedback - while some find them durable, others report they fell apart within two months. The fit is also mixed, with some finding them nice while others note they're not wide enough.

Review.review: These are my favorite shoes right now. They are comfortable and hold up well throughout the day. I get the men’s because they seem wider and more supportive than the women’s.

I've been wearing these shoes since I believe October 2023 (a few days after total hip replacement surgery). Other then being more dirty, they are still just as comfortable with everything in perfect condition more than a year later. I did research on good shoes for after the surgery and what is good to have, and for someone my age it mainly just seemed like having something with cushion and such that you didn't fall was most important.These shoes look great - I chose the black color as they're a bit more muted to suit my personal preference. These are wider with the soles which took a little bit of remeasuring to get used to when walking the first couple times, but then it was an afterthought. The cushioning is amazing! These are super comfortable. I've always been athletic until pretty much COVID, then the hip issue, and I've loved the Adidas brand, so have been perfect!These helped through the initial post-surgery steps, through physical therapy, through regaining my strength, and now with regular daily walking and whatnot.Definitely not waterproof, but perhaps waterproofing spray may help a bit. I live in the PNW so it rains when it's not the other season, but it hasn't bothered me yet.Bottom-line: Well-worth the purchase, definitely great for rehabilitation purposes, great for walking and stability.

This is my second pair of these shoes. I bought the first pair two years ago to take on a vacation to France and they were so good that this year I bought another pair, for you guessed it, another European vacation. What initially attracted me to these is that they are subtle yet comfortable. Yes, you can wear whatever shoes you want but in Europe, people tend to dress better, and their shoes are less flamboyant but still comfortable for hours and miles of walking. The purple is very subdued, and I have no problem wearing these just about anywhere. They're an ideal travel shoe because they are lightweight, breathable and supportive, all while being a fantastic value for the price. The name Ultrabounce conjures up thoughts of springy marshmallow comfort. I would say that's not entirely accurate. Yes, the shoes are comfortable but they are not crazy soft (like Hoka or some of the other super cushioned options out there)  and I think that's a good thing; they're cushioned enough to be comfortable but supportive enough to take care of your feet. What I also like about them is the way they fit. I have notoriously difficult feet to fit; I have narrow feet with high arches. While many companies are embracing the wider is better, especially in the toebox, these Adidas Ultrabounce runners have a welcomed medium to slightly narrow fit, perfect for me. In terms of size, I wear a size 12 in Nike and Asics; an 11.5 in Brooks and the 11.5 in these fit me perfectly. So why only 4 stars? I'm being picky, the insole is very basic and could do with more arch support; also, and this is a small thing, the laces are really long, they could be a little shorter. I worry that these will be discontinued, which would be a shame since they've become my go-to travel shoe and I bet that most people will appreciate them too. Buy them if you still can!
Comfy shoe with great look. Im hoping to use these for biking and running. My favorite brand shoe with a prefect appearance.

Not to narrow and not too wide. Comfortable toe box area. And good heal lock. Require minimum breaking in.

title: adidas Men's Lightblaze Glow Sneaker

Review.review: I do regular walks for my health, and normally use basketball sneakers because shoes in my size are rare. I wear a 17 US Mens, and that is not often found in other sneakers. Adidas actually made these in big sizes! I found no defects in the construction, or material of the shoes. The fit is very good, the ankle support is not there is you plan on using these for cross training. However when it comes to walking they are great. They are extremely light, I mean lighter than canvas sneakers while at the same time providing a lot more cushion. If you are not used to these types of walking shoes it does take a little bit of time to get used to. It literally feels like you are walking on a memory foam mattress at first. After a couple of days I started to break them in. They feel great on asphalt, concrete, gravel, and even some uneven terrain. The price was reasonable when compared to other walking shoes with similar padding and construction. If you want to take up walking I would recommend this pair.

These shoes fit true to size and have impressively held up over nearly three weeks of wear. They remain as comfortable as the first time I put them on. What's remarkable is that I don't even need to use inserts, which is quite rare for me due to my hubby's flat feet and other foot issues.Additionally, they resist showing dirt... after wearing them in dusty conditions, they wipe clean effortlessly. I am not sure about the lights, as I chose the ones without the lights.Having learned the importance of investing in high~quality shoes for good foot health due to past issues, I can confidently say that these shoes are a fantastic value. I truly love this brand, and these shoes exemplify the quality and comfort that make them worth every penny!

These are good sneakers that fit well and have a great bounce to them.  I don't know how long the bounce will hold up, but it is really nice to use these for walking or just wearing them all day.  The size is just right and they hug the foot well.  The only issue I have is that the rise on the back of the sneaker is just a bit too high for me.  When wearing no-show socks, the back of the sneaker rubs against the back of my foot and starts to get uncomfortable.  I am comparing these to a similar running show I have from Mizuno and I like the other one better due to the better shoelace design and lower rise on the back.  Overall though, this is a very good sneaker.

I got these for my son, meant to be his next shoes after sizing up. He's currently a 5.5 so I got him the 6.5 figuring he'd size into them with growing room. These are smaller feeling on his foot then his 5.5 old shoes. He also says they are narrow and squeeze his foot. He does not have wide feet, and we've not had that problem with shoes before. I do like the look of them on him, very cool on a eleven year old. They have a nice wide heel with good stability which is good since he has some pronation in his feet. Also he doesn't often wear sandals because of his pronation, so occasionally wears sneakers without socks in the summer. These are so scratchy inside that would not be comfortable with these. In the end these feel like a mid-quality shoe, but with good sole and support. The top feels a bit lower quality, and very scratchy. Our main problem is with sizing, running a full side smaller then expected, and a bit narrow.

I’ve got to say I really like Adidas sneakers and gym shoes. So when I saw these walking shoes, the design intrigued me, so I thought I’d give them a try. I’m glad I did.They not only fit my size 9 foot like a glove, but the added padding made it feel like I was walking on a cloud. I think they combine great style with comfort at a price that you’d expect to pay for a good pair of Adidas shoes.My only comment would be that though they fit my feet well, if you have an exceptionally wide foot, they might be too narrow for you.

I picked these up for my teenager.  He's about to start a new job where he will be on his feet all day long and a new pair of supportive shoes would certainly help.  He reports that they fit his foot exactly and he loved the style.  He walked around the house in them and he said they felt "good".  (He's a man of many words, that one).The laces are long enough and based on how he wears his shoes, these should last him a year or more.  We've never bought Adidas for him before.  We've done New Balance, Asics, and Sketchers.
These running shoes are very comfortable according to my son. They have good cushion and he likes the look of them.

My son really likes these shoes.  They fit him perfect and he says they are really comfortable. I think they look good with any outfit too.  They feature a mesh upper which helps your foot to breathe.  I think the quality is good with a thick rubber sole for support and a good grip. My son wears them everywhere, but the only complaint he has about them is that the tongue of the shoe is shaped weirdly and feels a little different. The tongue slides to the side of his foot. Other than that, I think you get a pretty good shoe for the money.

This shoes find my done so perfectly,and comfortably.I recommend buying this item

So I went down a rabbit hole to look for the PERFECT everyday sneaker and something that's robust and inexpensive as well. And let me tell you if you can find the right size for this shoe, it's well worth the hassle if the shoe FITS.Fit & Sizing:Now in terms of fit I unfortunately had to try THREE different sizing, to summarize- I'm normally a UK 9 (US9.5), and I saw reviews to size up but it was WAY too big for me, then ordered a size US9.5 which was OKAY, but I did the shove toes to the front of the toe box while seeing how many fingers I can put into the heel.. And it was 2 fingers (supposed to be 1 finger snugly). I tested it out walking for a whole day for about 4 miles walk and I didn't feel any fatigue from that. But the fit just felt a little off, that the heel still felt loose. I could still fit 2 fingers when doing that test. So finally I ordered a size US8.5 and YES it fits, BUT the joint above the toes (Metatarsal area) feels a little bit tight at the moment.I will update this review if it breaks in well and whether I was a lunatic to not stick with my true size. Will break in and update.Breathability:Shoes are fairly breathable. It is by no means a jogging shoe like running shoes but it's not suffocating. I'm hoping that this will be an all season shoe for me and this feels like a good balance  for this fall and hopefully the winter.Color:Ultimate dad shoe vibes- love the 90s classic aesthetic and texture (I got the Cloud White/Charcoal/Putty Grey), I'm happy this will pair with my minimalist outfits and I enjoy the simplicity of this colorway. If you're a uniqlo fan this shoe fits the bill pretty well with a lot of fits.Additional notes/Durability:Do note that I really went in the deep end to discover and research the perfect shoe not just for everyday use but also using this for occasional hikes too- because the sole is lugged (4.5mm) and it should be good for casual, occasional hikes. And also Adidas has a partnership with Continental I can attest from another a pair of Ultra Boost that these soles last a very long time. So it's amazing in terms of value- just behind VIBRAM but the shoes that have that technology tends to be a lot more expensive depending on model, around 100-200usd and above (like Hoka pricing). So I expect this shoe to last a long time.Conclusion:Don't sleep on this model, it's very underrated right now especially if it's on sale. Try it and be wary of the sizing problems. I'd say go for your true size and be prepared to go a size down, and disclaimer that everyone's feet is different.

title: adidas Unisex-Adult Vulcraid3r Slip on Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes to be of good quality and worth their price. However, the fit receives negative feedback, with customers noting they run very narrow and are uncomfortable. Moreover, durability is a concern as the insoles fall apart after just one month of use. Additionally, customers have mixed opinions about the shoes' appearance, with some saying they look great while others disagree. The constriction and heel stability aspects also receive mixed reviews.

Review.review: Great shoe - not sure if I would label this a running shoe...maybe a walking shoe.  Casual.  I normally fit 10.5 and needed to get an 11, but worth the price.
A bit narrow but overall fantastic shoe.

Shoe fits great. It does hug the middle of your foot, so if you have wide feet, maybe go wide or something different. They feel great for awhile but long walks, like mall shopping or tourist trips are not recommended. After awhile your feet will start to hurt and you can’t wait to take them off.

I have narrow feet and heels usually have problems with shoes coming loose at the heel and ankle area. I purchased these based on some of the reviews that stated that these shoes ran small/narrow. The problem is that the elastic appearing band at the arch of the shoe is actually not elastic and appears to be more of a cosmetic touch. Even with my narrow feet, I had problems getting my foot into the shoe without a fair amount of effort assisted by a shoe horn. The band is relatively rigid and places a great deal of constriction in the midfoot area and along the inner arch of the foot. Once my foot is in the shoe, this constriction is very obvious and yet the heel/ankle area remain loose. This is a very non-anatomically sized shoe. The length appears to be true to fit, its just this midfoot band that is extremely uncomfortable. Also, the sole of this shoe is very stiff. It is not at all flexible unlike what you would normally expect in a casual slip on shoe. I was very disappointed as I liked the cosmetics of the shoe. Unfortunately, I have to say that this is one of the most uncomfortable shoes that I have ever purchased. I should have heeded the negative reviews that talked about how uncomfortable these shoes are. I just thought that it was because people had purchased the wrong size shoe. However, it is the construction and design of the shoe that makes it ill-fitting and uncomfortable. Perhaps that is why they are discounted so much. I have owned several pair of Adidas shoes (in the past they tended to fit well as they tended to accommodate narrower feet like mine). However, this is the first Adidas shoe style that I could not wear (in the proper 8.5 size) due to extreme discomfort. Again, quit a disappointment as I thought that I could snag a “deal” as I really liked the sleek and clean look of the shoe. Will definitely be returning after just trying them on for 3-5 minutes.
They feel like the modern Vans slip-on.. I'm guessing as durable (haven't had them long), and they cool just a bit cooler tbh.. worth the money for sure

Realistically- I wish I had spent $10 more and gotten basic white shoes that I can wear without pain.

title: adidas Men's Grand Court 2.0 Tennis Shoe
Customer_say: Customers praise these tennis shoes for their top-notch quality, classic Adidas style, and good value for money. The shoes are comfortable, with one customer noting they fit well under the arch of the foot, and feature a soft leather build with amazing cushioning. While some customers report the shoes hold up well, others mention issues with stitching coming apart. The fit receives mixed feedback, with some finding it true to size while others say it runs half a size too small.

Review.review: I normally don’t gush over tennis shoes, but the adidas Grand Court 2.0 just forced me to. From style to comfort to sturdiness, these deliver everything you could want—and more—for the price.✅ Sleek, Classic LookThese deliver an effortlessly clean, old-school tennis style that works in nearly any casual or sporty setting. The iconic 3‑Stripes and crisp white leather pop beautifully. I’ve gotten multiple compliments already—people assume I spent way more.✅ Instant Comfort & SupportNo break-in needed—these felt great from day one. The padded collar gives serious ankle support, while the OrthoLite® sockliner molds perfectly to your foot and helps manage sweat. Even after full days of running and walking, my feet feel fresh and supported.✅ Reliable Build QualityThe synthetic leather upper is durable and wipes clean easily—no peeling or fraying even after daily wear. The rubber cupsole balances firmness and flexibility, offering traction and durability all week long.✅ Versatile & Easy to StylePerfect for casual Fridays, weekend errands, or hitting the court. I pair mine effortlessly with both jeans and activewear, and they just blend in. Also, despite the name, I find these great for everyday walking too.Bottom Line:Whether you’re buying these as an entry-level sneaker or supplement to your athletic rotation, the Grand Court 2.0 is an absolute win for style, comfort, and build, all at a great price.Bonus for adidas:If you’re looking for a detail-oriented reviewer who loves honest feedback and product testing, I’d be thrilled to help review more from your lineup in exchange for early access or testing units 😄.Bottom line: Five stars — I’ll definitely be back for more colors and maybe a backup pair.
Nice. All soft leather, old school style and colors, comfortable and light. Budget friendly pricing and fast delivery.Very pleased with my purchase.
I purchased these shoes for my brother, and he loves them! They fit h8m perfectly and they are comfortable on his feet.
The shoe has great traction. My son loves the unique color and the comfortability of the shoe

They also seem to be holding up well. I would buy them again.

These Adidas sneakers are a total game-changer! Super comfortable from the very first step — it honestly feels like walking on clouds. The design is clean, stylish, and goes with everything, whether you're dressing up or keeping it casual. Plus, the quality is top-notch, just what you'd expect from Adidas. If you're thinking about getting them, don’t hesitate — you’re going to love them!

They're super cute and I get compliments on them, but I won't buy adidas shoes again after this experience.Original review for black:When I first bought these I wasn't a fan. They were hard to put on without bending the back of the shoe, they weren't as comfy as my old cloudforms, and my usual size didn't fit. I am always a 9.5 in sneakers, but for these I had to return them and get a 10 because my toes were jammed in there. I got a shoe horn to help with puting them on, and that has saved me from a lot of pain. They are still comfy enough for every day wear, but I would not go walking miles in these. Even with these issues, I find myself wearing them often and choosing them over other tennis shoes because the material is high quality, the black color goes with everything, and they're super cute. Overall, I like them and bought another color, but I subtracted a star for the few issues I had to correct.

Review.review: These shoes have been a hit in our house! My kiddo absolutely loves them and wears them every day — whether it’s for school, the playground, or just running around outside. They’re super lightweight, flexible, and comfortable, which is perfect for an active kid. The knit upper has a nice stretch and keeps his feet cool, and the EVA midsole provides great cushioning with every step. I also really like the chunky rubber outsole — not only does it look stylish, but it gives excellent grip, even on slick surfaces.I also appreciate that they’re made with recycled materials — it’s a small but meaningful step in the right direction. Definitely recommend if you’re looking for a durable, comfy, and eco-friendly pair of kids’ shoes!

These shoes are a hybrid between traditional and slip on design.  There’s no shoe tongue.  Instead, it’s made of elastic cool material that stretches when you insert your feet into them.  There’s a flap that has laces like traditional shoes so you can further tighten them if it’s still loose.  My daughter loves the fun girly color and says they’re very comfortable.  The size runs slightly big so order down if your kids have smaller feet.Now for the not so good. The sole is more plasticky than grippy rubber.  I compare every shoes to Merrell since I consider them the benchmark.  Merrell use super soft grippy rubber soles.  In my opinion, it’s not the best value for your money at $70.  Cross shop and consider Merrell as an alternative.
My son said these are the most comfortable shoes!

I ordered these Adidas Captor Flow 2.0 sneakers for my 10 year old niece knowing that school will be starting next month and she will want a new pair of sneakers. There are several color combos to order from and I debated about ordering the white with the fluorescent pink and yellow but white sneakers get so dirty and I knew they would be dirty in a week so I opted for the gray with purple combo.These sneakers are a tight knit, breathable mesh and the shoe is in one piece, no tongue, with man made leather eyestays with purple loops and tie laces. There is a high heel tab which makes putting them on a little easier although I have a pair of Adidas shoes with the high tab in the back and I needed to buy heel tab socks to prevent rubbing on the top of my heel, she wear ankle socks so it shouldn’t be a problem. There is also a heel reinforcement as well as an extra rubber tab at the toes although she is rough on sneakers so I am not sure these will help. The inner sole is their patented Cloudfoam for cushioning and these shoes have a decent arch as well. The sole is white with a touch of purple to match the shoes and it’s constructed of the typical foam soles you find in most sneakers these days, it feels hollow but it’s a lightweight synthetic foam rubber.These shoes are nicely constructed and my niece really likes the style of this shoe, it’s current and she even likes the grey and purple color combo  (she usually almost always picks out pink!). The price point is about average for brand name kids sneakers but these Kaptir Flow 2.0 sneakers are nice quality and my niece said they are super comfortable so the price is a good value. Overall, she gave them two thumbs up!

Review.review: Update: Photo shown of this pair of shoes after 14 months of almost daily use.These Adidas Runfalcon slip-on sneakers have been my daughter’s absolute favorite since she got it almost a year ago—and mine too, as a parent of a neurodivergent child with low muscle tone. She fell in love with the black and purple color combo (her two favorite colors!), and I love that the colors are not only pretty but also practical—dirt and scuffs don’t show easily.What makes these shoes stand out is the ease of use. Tying laces can be frustrating for my daughter on most days, and these slip-ons have been a game-changer. She can put them on independently, which gives her a boost of confidence and saves us all time and stress.As a parent, I was initially concerned about safety and grip, but these sneakers have great traction. The material is easy to clean, and even after a year of daily wear, they still look and perform great. Most importantly, they’re comfortable enough for all-day use—no complaints about foot pain, even with her low tone.The price point (around $50) is very reasonable for the quality. Honestly, I’m just so happy to have found a stylish, functional, and budget-friendly shoe that works for her needs. I highly recommend for other parents navigating similar challenges.
Kid love this shoe and easy to put on and off

Review.review: Obsessed with these sneakers. They are light weight and comfy.  They are not stiff and immediately felt like my feet had been "breaking them in" for weeks, just pure toe tapping comfort from the start.  The quality seems good and I am not concerned that these are not "real" adidas, they look legit.  I always take a size 9 women's in adidas which I did for these, and they fit great.  When I first put them on, I was concerned for one second that my left big shoe was a tad small, but after wearing them for 10 minutes that issue disappeared.  I got these for $65, which is a good price.  The colors look just like pictured online, and the bubblegum pink with the neon yellow/tennis ball green looks very cool and unique.  I will spray them with suede protector to hopefully keep them clean, because I think these will be very hard to clean if something bad happens.

They are so comfortable and stylish. I have gotten so many compliments on them. I wear them to run errands because I can keep them in all day and they don’t hurt. I wear an 81/2 but I bought a 9 because I saw that the shoe is narrow and it fits good. I would say size up if you have a bigger feet but if your feet is smaller you can go with your normal size only because they bend in the front if you get them too big.

The shoelaces that came with the shoes were 56 inches and had to use a double bow to wear them the first time! I'm 5'5" tall=65 inches, so 56 inches seems ridiculously long.

I have an older foot with a narrow heel, regular arch and a regular width in the toe area. These shoes fit perfectly. I think this shoe is true to size and the fit provided ample toe space which for me increases the comfort and my ability to wear this shoe all day for a lot of walking. I can adjust the fit with the ample laces to accommodate mild swelling or a slightly thicker sock when needed. The padding of the foot bed is engineered for comfort and did not disappoint me. They also provide excellent stability and maneuverability as I can mildly feel contact with the ground. Some say there is not enough cushion in the foot bed but I found them to be a perfect walking shoe with all day comfort. This popular style matches almost any type of casual dress and I even wore them in the gym.  They aren’t bulky and pack well so they are also a great travel shoe. This is my second pair and my daily “go to” shoe so I can say after a few years they are durable as well.

The Marvel theme is a big hit — the colors and details make the shoes stand out, and my child was excited to wear them right away. They look sporty and stylish, perfect for both school and play.The elastic laces with the Velcro strap are very practical. They make it easy for kids to put the shoes on and take them off without help, which is a big plus for independence. The fit is secure once fastened, and they don’t slip off during running, climbing, or everyday activities. The shoes are also lightweight, so they don’t feel bulky on small feet.In terms of comfort, the cushioning is soft and provides good support for walking and running. The material feels durable and breathable, which is important since kids wear sneakers all day. The sole has good traction, so I feel confident my child won’t slip easily on different surfaces.Overall, these sneakers are well-made, comfortable, and kid-approved. They strike a nice balance between function and style, making them a solid pick for everyday wear.

Who doesn't want hulk shoes? I wish these came in adult sizes! My son absolutely loves the look and feel of these, and Adidas are a time tested brand, you really can't go wrong when you opt for them.  The coloration is great on these and they fit very well (although we ordered a size up for our son so he will grow into them.  They seem to be a great color that won't get too dirty too quickly, and can be washed easily.  They have nice padding to them as well which is great for running around and helping him.  I would say these are a great priced sneaker for your child, especially with the Marvel theme that they have going for them, which is awesome considering how inexpensive they are.  They come with a strap too so he doesn't have to tie them every time which makes it easy to get out the door.  Overall, the quality of these shoes is great and I would recommend them for anyone!
These shoes look great but are extremely stiff inside out. Unfortunately my son doesn’t want to keep them on given how uncomfortable they are.

My 6-year-old absolutely loves these Marvel Run Falcon 5 sneakers! They are very comfortable thanks to the soft, stretchy upper that moves easily with his feet. The elastic laces and hook-and-loop strap make them super easy for him to put on and take off by himself, which is perfect for busy mornings.The fit is true to size, snug but not tight, and the cushioned EVA midsole provides lightweight support that absorbs impact, keeping his feet comfortable even after hours of running and playing. The rubber outsole is non-marking and grippy, making them safe for indoor and outdoor use.What I really appreciate is the quality and durability—these sneakers feel well-made, and even after several weeks of daily wear, they still look and feel like new. The bright colors are fun and appealing, and they’ve held up through playground adventures, running around, and casual wear. Overall, these sneakers are comfortable, durable, easy to wear, and perfect for an active child.

The colors on these shoes are vibrant! The 10 year old wearing them appreciates that there are no characters on the actual shoes because he just likes them for the colors. They are a snug fit compared to Keen. There's quite some height added for shock absorption, which surprised him at first, but it adds to the comfort. There's good arch support and the quality is great. At 42 USD, these seem like a regular price for boys' sneakers with this level of arch support and durability. These are much easier than lace up shoes and just a bit more effort than Skechers slip-ins.
The color on these shoes really POP. They are well made and are such a pop of color. My son loves these shoes.

But it's not necessarily a bad thing, just different. A lot of shoes are uncomfortable for me because my arches are low but these still feel good after an hour chasing my little one around the playground.I really like how the top of the tongue is cut so it doesn't press against my ankle, that really adds to the comfort.For kids, I prefer a wider toe box to make room for developing feet. But I'm used to narrower shoes and they feel fine to me in that regard.They seem quite solidly constructed so far, but I've only worn them a few times so I'll update if that changes any time soon.

Review.review: These toddler athletic shoes are lightweight, supportive, and easy to slip on and off. They stay secure during play and keep little feet comfortable all day. Great quality and super cute, too!

I purchased these shoes for my 4-year-old, and they have exceeded my expectations in every way! The comfort is top-notch—my little one has no complaints about wearing them all day. The stretchability makes them easy to slip on and off, which is a huge plus for independent toddlers.Style-wise, they are adorable and go with almost any outfit. They’re also incredibly lightweight, so my child runs around effortlessly. Most importantly, these shoes are durable and hold up to the normal wear and tear that comes with a toddler’s active lifestyle.Cleaning them is a breeze—they’re easy to wash and air dry. I do recommend removing the insoles before air drying for best results. One important tip: avoid heat drying in the dryer as the plastic components can melt.The price point is surprisingly affordable, especially compared to similar options in stores. Overall, these shoes are a fantastic buy, and I highly recommend them for any parent with a busy toddler!
