The Under Armour Men's Charged Surge 4 is a popular running sneaker known for being comfortable, lightweight, and versatile. It is considered a neutral shoe, providing a balance of flexibility and cushioning.Key features include a breathable mesh upper with synthetic overlays for structure, a Deluxe Comfort System sockliner that molds to your foot, and a Charged Cushioning midsole for responsiveness and durability. The sneaker also has a durable rubber outsole for traction.It's a great option for light exercise, walking, and all-day wear, and many reviewers find it to be a good value

Was wary of buying shoes without trying them on first.  But these are true to size and are pretty nice for jogging and daily wear.Pros: fits well, and give a lot of comfort.  These are some of the most cushioning shoes I've had.  Granted, I'm not on my feel all day, but I probably walk more than most office workers.Cons: Nothing significant.Other thoughts:These aren't "sneakers" in the way that they make you silent.  The bottom of the shoes are harder than my Nikes, and make a little bit of sound when you walk on a hard floor.  Not an issue unless you're an aspiring ninja.The bottom part of the shoe (the white piece) is larger than your feet.  This gives more stability, but makes your feet look a bit bigger than they are compared with my Nikes.The top of the shoes are breathable.  They are mesh rather than a simple fabric like my Nikes.  As a result, they don't stretch as much.  Just a personal preference which one you like more.Finally - this came in its original shoe box and the box was a bit squashed.  Didn't bother the shoe at all.

Review.review: My husband absolutely loves these shoes! He raves about how comfortable they are, noting the excellent additional support they provide. He particularly appreciates the little bounce they offer, which makes them great for walking.

Holy guacamole. These shoes are amazing! They have a nice lil bounce to em as well as being super light and comfy. They fit perfectly albeit the color is pretty wack.I neutral on the style choice of the tongue and laces being to the side. But I absolutely adore the feeling I get when doing a long run.In normal shoes as I get to the wall in my run, my old shoes would feel heavy, each stride felt like lugging buckets but in these babies you don’t feel that at all. Each bounce keeps those nagging negative runner thoughts at bay.I highly recommend these for 5-10k runs… hell even nice little sprints, they support you by lifting your stride it’s awesome. My feet never felt better.

These are trash compared to the vaporfly 2.  I could have gotten the same running experience out a 30 dollar pair of walmart brand shoes. No toe off, legs get super sore and tired after only 3 miles i feel lole a horse stuck in mud. Average times 2+ min slower. Waste of money

title: Nike Men's Pegasus Trail 5 GORE-TEX Waterproof Trail Running Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these trail running shoes to be of high quality, with exceptional shock absorbing heel cushioning and a great fit. They are durable, with one customer noting they shrug off rocks, and another mentioning the Invisible Fit membrane keeps water out. However, several customers report that the shoes run small in size.

Review.review: Great cushion, excellent traction, the shell and sole will last. I ordered a size 10, my usual size it fits well. I would buy again!

These shoes are absolutely wonderful!! I got these for my boyfriend as a surprise gift because he had the same pair that he works in maintenance and needs waterproof shoes as a must!!! he says that they are extremely comfortable and he is on his feet for 10 hours a day… highly recommend these they’re super comfortable, very easy to clean, very easy to wash in the washing machine, and they look great on him!! I’m just now writing a review six months later after purchasing them and they are still looking brand new! And he works in them every single day!!
They feel great on the feet. Like walking on a cloud. They don’t look goofy like hokas do. They are a good fit so ordering you size should be fine

Very nice shoe. Well built & appears durable. I especially loved the soft ankle.With high arch/high instep and wide forefoot, these shoes were not a good fit for me. Despite being men's running shoes, they felt like a women's B width. There is zero give the way they are stitched making them super tight across the forefoot at the base where lacing begins, and I mean cutting off circulation tight!It's clear to me that these shoes are made for heelstrikers with narrow feet:1) Exceptional shock absorbing heel cushioning that gives rather than squishes;2) Very little forefoot cushioning but provides good toe-off springboard action.What I found peculiar is that Nike did away with the 3rd gas tube running front to back with this model. No middle tube made my feet feel like they were being forced down midfoot—something that has actually resulted in stress fractures in the past—because I AM a supinator (underpronation, which means my natural gait strikes along the outside of my feet).They felt "corrective" so I would NOT recommend these to supinators, those with high arches and/or high instep, and definitely not to wide footers or wide forefooters, or forefoot strikers. Shin splints (along with other painful maladies) WILL occur—guaranteed!About me:  I was an avid fitness enthusiast years before I ever set foot in a commercial gym—and that was 35 years ago. Since then, I went on to become a personal trainer, taught aerobics for 20+ years, and have worked in numerous gyms—two of which I managed for some time.And for most of that time, I've been a Nike snob. However, their latest "improvements" on new models and elimination of older ones convey a simple message:  It's time to pack up my toys and move on. My groundpounders deserve compatible playmates.4 stars because I believe this to be a Nike typical, high-quality shoe. No 5th star because there is no mention or caution on the incredibly narrow width in a men's shoe, or the zero give with this new stitching, nor is there any information on the type of runner this shoe would—or would not benefit.
No fue el Color que seleccione, talla muy ajustado pero tiene una suave marcha
Bad size

I’ve put a little over forty Florida-summer miles on the Nike Pegasus Trail 5 GORE-TEX, most of them in sideways rain, and they’ve already earned a reserved spot by the door. The Invisible Fit membrane keeps water out without giving that plastic-bag feel—my socks stay dry, and the shoe flexes like a regular trainer instead of a clunky winter boot.Underfoot, Nike’s new ReactX midsole brings road-shoe energy to mud, roots, and crushed-shell paths. I finish runs feeling bouncier than I have any right to on swampy routes. The outsole lugs and sticky rubber grab wet boardwalks and slick limestone with zero drama, so I’m not tip-toeing every time a puddle shows up.Little design touches seal the deal: an extended ankle collar that blocks sand and pine needles, a 3-D toe cap that shrugs off rocks, and a black/grey colorway that looks totally normal at the brewery post-run. The only trade-offs are the premium price—about $180—and slightly warmer feet on steamy days. Thin socks solve the latter; the waterproof peace of mind justifies the former.Bottom line: If you want one shoe that handles ankle-deep puddles yet still feels lively on dry pavement, the Pegasus Trail 5 GTX delivers. Consider me converted.

title: Nike Women's Trail Running Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, lightweight, and well-made, with one noting they're classy enough for town wear. They are excellent for walking and running, and customers consider them a good value. The fit and color receive mixed feedback - while some find them a perfect fit, others say they run small, and while some like the color, others find it off.

Review.review: I bought a pair of these shoes from a local store back in 2018 and loved how they fit my foot like a glove and felt so light on my feet for any kind of activity.  I went back to the same store a couple of years later to buy them again but they did not carry the same model.  I was very happy to find them on Amazon in many more beautiful colors than the two colors my initial pair were available in.  I had bought my first pair for $60 and feel that spending $100+ is rather expensive but it is also difficult to find running shoes that feel so good and I loved the bright color so I bought 3 more pairs to hopefully keep me in running shoes for the next several years.  My first pair has held up very well for me and have been washed several times so I feel good about the overall quality of the shoes.I have low arches and have had double bunion surgery many years ago so I usually exchange the insoles that come in shoes for insoles with an arch.  I did not need to do this for about three years with my first pair but lately began having some toe pain so I simply added added a gel arch under the regular insole and that easily solved the problem.I generally wear a 5 or 5.5 but a 6 fits me perfectly.  I also have narrow heels and these shoes gently hug my feel all around, giving a solid feeling of stability and lightness.
I love them. They are a little bit big. I like everything about them. I have to wear heavier socks.
The most comfortable sneaker ever!
Perfect like walking on clouds. It’s tight around your foot in the best way. Definitely good for running or the gym. I run on a gravel road and I can’t feel the rocks.

Someone I know owns these shoes. I tried them on and liked them. I usually wear a 9.5 but ordered a 10 in these and they fit well. They are EXTREMELY comfortable and flexible. I think they are great shoes but they do have one drawback.I wore these on a beach and when I came home I had to pick out tiny pebbles from the sole. Same with mud. These shoes are flexible thanks to the honeycomb like sole but it fills with surface matter. Great around the house and on the dirt etc but a big pain on pebbles, gravel and mud.

These are my absolute favorite shoes. I use them for works outs and my work shoes for the hospital. I love that I can slip in and out of them without having to tie them. I think they are very lightweight and comfortable. The quality is very good and holds up well. I need a little more arch support in many of my shoes and even with these but this is purely bc of how my feet are only.

title: Nike Men's Reax 8 TR Cross Training Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable, terrific-looking, and well-fitting. However, the quality receives mixed feedback, with some saying they're great while others find them not up to Nike standards. Moreover, durability is a concern as the top lace holders break and they start creaking after less than six weeks of use. Additionally, customers disagree on whether the size matches the description, and opinions on value are divided between those who find them good for the price and those who consider them terrible shoes.

Review.review: This shoe is very comofrtable - very supportive - very durable - very stylish - and very cheap (for Nike)! You will not regret buying this shoe for just about any physical activity.
Fit a little small but comfortable alot of support. Well worth the money.

I purchased a pair after trying them on locally first. They are true to Nike size, comfortable and the built-in tongue is a plus for keeping it centered. But be cautious!!! After wearing them for 2 weeks, I'd estimate 6 miles of walking, they being to squeak. Not just a random squeak but a every time you take a step it bellows a eery squeak like the front door of a haunted house. Wildlife creatures are running for their lives when I attempt to walk my local natural trail. Hunters are angry that I scared off the 8 point buck from a mile away that they've been staying all season. I seriously can't hide at work. They know exactly where I am and when I'm walking down the halls. I'm 5' 10'', 185. It's not like I'm hurting the shoes but they are screaming for help with every step! I know, I know. It's just a inexpensive pair of shoes that some hard working child in Indonesia put blood and sweat into producing.  I really do appreciate every tear that they shed to glue them together, but they missed a spot. The most important spot. The spot that keep the shoe from squeaking. So to everyone that's has to hear me walk in them in the local Walmart and Target, I'm sorry! I wearing them for your enjoyment (with earbuds in my ears) so you can have a laugh for the day. One little star. You're welcome...

Maybe a little snug but I like it that way because I don’t feel like they’re going to slide off my feet when I’m walking or if my feet get sweaty.

My husband loves these shoes. He wore them out till they had hardly any tread on them. He will definitely be wearing these again!

The first day I wore these, I went for a walk, and upon my walk was a nice big pile of dog doo doo. I was unaware of this big pile of doo-doo until it was too late. As I flew ybackward, I recall looking up at the sky, and to my surprise, I saw one of my brand new shoes flying by.  Next thing I knew I was lying there on the cold, hard sidewalk in such shock I layed there for what felt like forever. I slowly began to rise to my feet. I started to check myself for any injuries when suddenly I got a whiff of a nostril-burning foul smell. I reached my hand around to my back only to bring it right back abruptly.  I let out a loud scream followed by a gagging reaction to the dog poop that was now on my hand.  I ran to the grass and dropped to my knees I frantically began wiping my hand on the grass. As a tear ran down my face I remembered thinking can this day get any worse? Well, guess what it did! Behind me was a loud bark that scared me so much I jumped forward. I was now lying on the ground once more. As I got to my knees, I stood up quickly, eager to see the culprit that I believed to be the doggy doo doo bandit, but as I turned around to confront this demon, I promptly began to plead because in this dogs mouth was my other shoe I slowly began to approach this dog as I got close enough I made a daring move I tried to jump on the dog. I was unsuccessful with dog poop on my back, and with only one shoe on, I began to walk home sad and smelly.  Anyway I hope this helps your decision to buy these shoes or not

Review.review: I love these!! My son is 12 and finally hit “man” size sneakers. The comfort difference is significant because he absolutely doesn’t stop talking about the support and bounce these have. They look fantastic and the colors are even better in person. This Nike Pegasus 39 is a perfect pair of running shoes for people who value money, quality shoe material, etc. I find it really light and soft to wear. I like that it has an all-black option—classy looking and stylish for all types of clothing.

It was a pleasant experience running with this shoe! I got about 260 miles of running out of it  before having to purchase new ones as my ankles were flaring up. I did use these for work outside as well, but my job had minimal walking, but I think it may have worn the shoes down a bit! Will continue using for my job and have a new shoe dedicated only to running. Going to be a year since I have had purchased these
Shoes are great, love the color, shipping was slow though.

To me, this is the one of the nicest looking running shoes out there right now. White is a great shoe color and most running shoes look ugly in my opinion.I was concerned coming into this with how dirty it would look due to dirt, but it's actually very manageable. Simply throw it in the washing machine with some Oxyclean, air dry, and it looks nearly brand new. If excessively soiled, soak in Oxyclean overnight and then wash.The fit is true to size but slightly snug as you break it in. The entire front of the shoe is like a soft mesh so it's very comfortable, but that also means if you kick anything it'll hurt, trust me. The cushion is pretty good- an upgrade over non running shoes but not excessive like Hoka's. I can walk for about one and a half hours before my feet actually start hurting.Overall, would recommend. Definitely is kinda pricey but it's hard to find good looking running shoes so it's an L I was willing to take.
Fit perfectly

title: New Balance Men's 608 V5 Casual Comfort Cross Trainer
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable, well-made, and appreciate their long-lasting durability, noting they wear well for several years. They provide good arch support, particularly with inserts, and customers consider them excellent value for money. The size receives mixed feedback - while some say they are true to size and width, others find them too small.

Review.review: I am thoroughly amazed and grateful these are just what I needed. My last pair of NB were walking shoes and was last bought 5 or 6 years ago. I do tons of walking but don't drag my feet so the soles don't wear fast and I don't let them get wet, but it was time to get a new pair. These new ones are perfect in every way, absolute comfort, roominess, but snug enough fit with a good amount of comfort padding inside, and they have the exact size dimensions of the last size 15's I had from 5 to 6 years ago, maybe a slight tad wider for even better comfort. I love that they don't pronate (tilt to one side from overly spongy soles) and are even more stable for the ankle than the last ones. They also don't have excessive heel height which is a huge problem for me in this trend of making heels too high since i have ankle issues and had to have surgery on my feet at age 4, so I was told my my orthopedic doctor my feet could not handle excess sloping, i.e., higher heels. In this regard, it reminds me of barefoot shoes with a flatter more even profile, but still with good arch support and still perfect shock absorbing comfort (not excessive since I can't handle excess arches). Glad I came across the perfect fit shoe for me, though there is one thing I hope will last and that is four of the shoelace eyelets in the middle were done differently for stylistic reasons: they are put through some type of fabric loop instead of the leather that the other holes are made to go through. If those loops have stitching that fails at some point then one would have to resort to drilling a hole into the leather where it normally would go through because they had to do this "cool" looking style feature. Who knows, maybe it will last okay. The price is great too, and hope they don't read this and raise it!
The fit is perfect. The size is exactly what it says it is they’re comfortable well-made and perfect for work shoes awesome value. Very good support good quality shoe.

These shoes were recommended to me by a podiatrist friend.  He said they were the best bargain out there for a quality tennis shoe that was actually good for your feet.  I can't agree more.  These have become my go to tennis shoe.  I walk about 15 miles a week on a wooded trail and these have held up over a year.  I have ordered several extra pairs for wearing around the house or with shorts in the summer.  They have all performed great and they are so comfortable.They have been called "Dad" shoes...well I am a Dad so no problem here.

It’s not the greatest show but i’m a sucker for an old man show. Comfortable and they fit my feet pretty well. Not to bad if you drive manual and want a shoe you can do that in too. They don’t look to bad in my opinion ether, solid buy for the price i got it at.

This is not the shoe for shoe afficianados.  Although the style is very basic, it is very comfortable and stable while exercising.  This an ideal "dad shoe" for those looking for a solid daily wear shoe.

I bought this pair (12W) on August 23, 2024 and they have been great to wear on my daily walks. I have walked nearly 2 million steps since then in these shoes and they have great durability. I rotate them with another pair that I bought on Oct. 27, 2024, which has helped reduce the wear and tear. I removed the insoles and replaced them with PowerStep ProTech Control Orthotic Insoles and my feet feel great. The weight feels great on my feet and I don't have any foot fatigue after walking 10,000-20,000 steps in them. The 12W are now too wide for my feet but I still highly recommend this shoe. They are easy to clean and still look good on the outside. On the inside, I've worn the heel area out.I purchased the White/Team Royal version in size 12. I loved these as they fit better as I've been losing weight. The downside, the inside cushioning around the heel and ankle is gone. Worn out. I guess roughly 2,000,000 steps is a bit too much for this pair. Nonetheless, I do recommend these 608s.

Using these as outside work shoes since I walk over 7000 steps a day 6 days a week. The fit is perfect and they are true to size. The weight is about that of a casual hiking shoe; obviously not as light as a runner but not as heavy as my old work shoes. They feel both comfortable and tough at the same time. I’m hoping this will be the perfect combination for out door work where I don’t need a steel toe or necessarily strong water resistance.

title: Nike Men's Free Metcon 6 Workout Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these workout shoes comfortable, stylish, and lightweight, with good stability that provides confidence during heavier lifts. Moreover, they appreciate the quality, with one customer noting the sock liner design for ankle support, and consider them the best all-purpose workout shoe. However, the fit receives mixed feedback - while some find them snug to put on, others mention they're hard to get on and off. Additionally, opinions about size vary, with some finding them suitable for wide feet while others note they run a bit small.

Review.review: I ordered the Nike Metcon 6 Free about a week ago, and I’ve been pleasantly surprised with the performance right from the start. The shoes are extremely comfortable, offering a secure yet flexible fit that adapts well during both lifting and conditioning workouts. What stood out the most is how easy they were to break in—practically no adjustment period was needed. Within the first couple of sessions, they already felt like a natural extension of my training routine.The breathability is another strong point; the mesh upper keeps my feet cool even during long, high-intensity workouts. The stability in the heel gives confidence under heavier lifts, while the forefoot remains flexible enough for sprints, jumps, and dynamic movements. It’s a rare balance of support and comfort that makes the Metcon 6 Free versatile for both strength and functional training.Overall, this shoe delivers on all fronts: comfort, stability, and ease of use. If you want a training shoe that won’t slow you down with a long break-in period, the Metcon 6 Free is a solid choice.
Lightweight and very comfortable. Fit is great.

This version of the Free Metcon (Version 6) is by far the best all-purpose workout shoe that I've ever used. I really put my workout sneakers through the ringer; using them 7-days a week for weight training and cardio (3.5 miles/day of incline treadmill). Aside from comfort, being lightweight, and accommodating wider feet (unlike version 5 of the same sneaker), what really stands out about these is their versatility. I've never had a workout sneaker (metcon, running sneaker, powerlifting shoe) that has provided ample stability to perform barbell squats while also being comfortable, flexible, and lightweight enough to do an hour of cardio in. I wish that they lasted me slightly longer than 5 months, but considering what I put them through, these are great value for the money. I've purchased 5 total pairs of these and would recommend to anyone for almost any application.

The Nike Metcon 6 is an excellent all around athletic, workout shoe because it provides good cushioning, stability, breathability and flexibility. Before purchasing these shoes for my Gold'sFit workout class, I used running shoes, but running shoes did not provide enough lateral support and stability during lifts and doing side to side movement. The Nike Metcon 6 feel much more stabile and confidently perform through a variety of activities. When I started looking at other people's shoes in the gym, I was surprised how many also also chose the Nike Metcon.

Fits true to size. The design makes for slip resistant grip and excellent quality for walks in all seasons. The material is thin enough for breathability while still offering support. These shoes function as date night and workout options.

*Cons about the buying experience (not the shoes themselves)-  I was excited to find these shoes for my husband, highly discounted; but did not realize I was buying shoes that were already worn before. I’ve shared photos of what they looked like, immediately after opening the package from Amazon- just not happy about the fact that I thought I was buying BRAND NEW shoes, which these were obviously not! Since he needed the shoes now, I decided to not return them, but just wanted to leave this review to let others know what I experienced. Yes, the price was a great deal and the shoes are comfortable and no tread is noticeably gone, but the dog shit on the bottom and a big spot on the top of one shoe…is just unacceptable. I have purchased things that were used before and have no problem with that, but after double checking myself, I realized that was not the case this time, with these shoes.*Pros- These Adidas are the second pair I’ve bought, for the ease of slip-on feature and the option to purchase in a wide width…super convenient and very comfortable! The bottoms feel like they’d be slippery, but my husband says they’re really not. The insoles are not as soft as his other pair (different style), but he says they feel like they’ll be more durable!So I’d definitely leave a 5 star review for the shoes themselves, but 3-star was given simply because they were not new, as described.

I started using these shoes on June 11, 2019.  At the time of this writing, that's almost 6 weeks. I'd suggest when you are reading these reviews you keep in mind how long the reviewer has been trying out the shoes; it can take several weeks to fully get used to a new shoe and reviewers who give hasty reviews (either good or bad) are not giving you the real picture.____________________In a nutshell, I got these shoes so I didn't have to spend a bunch of money on running shoes AND gym shoes. Nor clutter up my closet with too many pairs of shoes.  After using them for over a month, I am surprisingly satisfied.First off....I'm 6 foot and 175 lbs. My shoe size varies between 10.5 and 11 USA. My foot is slightly wide, with good arches.  I got these shoes in a size 11 and they fit great.  But not at first.....for the first 4-5 wearings they felt tight around the middle of my foot. At first I was disappointed and felt like they were not going to be a good fit. But after about a week of wearing them, they broke in just fine, and the fit now is great. I attribute the tight feeling to the plastic side braces that the shoestrings lace through: if you lace them overly tight, that will contribute to the uncomfortable feeling.My experience:  I have been running at least 3X a week for over 40 years. I've weightlifted and/or cross trained on a regular basis for over 30 years. I have been a personal trainer in the past (certified by ACE). I've run one of the toughest marathons in the world (Big Sur International Marathon), although I consider myself an average runner. I've used everything from cheap $40.00 Big 5 shoes for running to $130.00 Brooks. I've never bought a pair of shoes specifically for weight training or cross-fit workouts; I've always used running shoes for that.Here's how I wear them:- running 1-2 times a week. My average run is around 2.5 miles, but I've run up to 6 miles in them and they performed well. I would not recommend wearing these for regular runs longer than 3 miles because that's not what they are built for. I run mostly on pavement in California (moderate weather), although I just did a 6 mile run on trails in preparation for a 10K race later this month.  I feel like that was pushing the shoe to its limit, but it did fine.- stationary biking.- weight workouts. I do squats, standing barbell curls and overhead presses and these shoes are stable and don't shift. Of course you need to adjust the tightness of the laces depending on what you're doing and that's the cool thing about these - you can loosen them up a bit for non-critical exercises like stationary biking or tighten them up for running or squats.- kettle bell swings: again, they are stable and flexible.- burpees: this particular exercise really tests the stability, flexibility and shock-absorption of the shoe. If you've never done a burpee, I suggest Googling it to see what the movements are. In this exercise the shoe is subjected to squats, kick-outs where I land on the toes as I do a push-up, then they flex as I bring my feet back under me and jump up into the air, forcing them to not only be stable in launching me up but in absorbing my return to earth.I work out in these shoes 6 days a week.  The photo shows them as of today, nearly 6 weeks into daily use.  I typically run a couple days a week, do burpees 2x a week, weight lift 2-3 times a week, kettle bell swing 2x a week and do moderate cardio such as stationary bike 1-2 times a week.I didn't buy these to replace running shoes; I got them to use as short-distance runners and gym shoes. You shouldn't get these if you are doing multiple runs of more than 3 miles in a week - they aren't going to give the performance and protection you need for serious running. But for gym work, cross fit training and shorter runs, they are great and can replace expensive running shoes.You should note that the plastic shoe lace-ups/brackets on the side of the shoe have 3 positions. The position closest to your toes is the least secure/loosest fitting style. Each hole you lace going back towards your heel tightens the shoe's grip on your foot.  I use the middle lace hole for running and burpees and the stability is fine.  I lace it all the way to the back hole for squats to make sure the shoe doesn't slip.I've noted some reviewers say the "sock" collar around the ankle opening is loose.  I can say yes, it doesn't fit flush to your ankle when laced up, but that doesn't mean it slips! My foot is stable even if the sock appears to be loose-fitting. It isn't overly warm or hot, either (I was worried about that when I first got them).Again, if you're a serious runner I'd invest in good running shoes and use these for the gym. But if you're a casual runner of shorter distances and fit in weight training and/or cross-fit training, these shoes do a great job.I'll close by saying that in the last 20 years or so I've gotten wiser and have spent more money on running shoes, and with these shoes I've gotten my first shoe specially designed for cross-training also. I am happy with the performance of the shoes so far. I've never had a serious running injury, partially out of luck but largely because as my joints have gotten older I've used better shoes.  Good luck and good health to you!

Review.review: These shoes arrived on time and in perfect condition. They are a fabulous fit at size 8 and I use them daily at the gym. I am a lifelong NIKE customer and this quality is on point with the Nike brand. Very good heel cushion as I have some slight heel pain to deal with. Four stars for the design of the shoe laces. I have thin ankles and the shoe slips unless you thread the shoelaces through the second loophole at the top of the shoe lace row. I realize it is a 'me' problem and not a shoe problem - but thought it would be helpful to share how I solved this problem to make the shoe work for me. Also, the shoe is lightweight and cool - the bottoms are light colored. If you live in a very hot climate (like VEGAS) the asphalt is very very hot. If you wear a dark sole shoe it absorbs the heat and makes your feet so very hot. I would recommend wearing a thinner sock with this shoe if you are a runner/walker. It seems to enhance the comfort. Excellent shoe for the gym and very stylish!

I bought this for cross training/HIIT and weight lifting to replace my old Nike. I paid 48 dollars for the grey color, which is perfect for my needs. This shoe is super light (I don't lile bulky shoes) and can feel like barefoot at times. It performs really well on body combat classes for high kicks and jumps, it does well on weight training, and it is almost good for HIIT. My only negative for it is that it has very limited lateral support for HIIT training, and that it feels a bit too wide/roomy for my narrow-ish feet (I'm a 7, 117lbs/5'5" and bought a 7). Also it slides backwards slightly for lunges, but not for squats. It also slides backwords for planks, so I need to place my feet on the mat to stay put.I did some light treadmill running in these and they worked for the lower intensity/short runs as well.Overall, I reccomend this shoe. If it's for walking / kicking around, these are super light and comfy and cute. If it's for cross training, these offer a very lightweight, responsive shoe (as opposed to the bulky ones with added whistles and bells) and it may surprise you that you will pick them every time for a quick gym workout.

​Run, Don't Walk, Away from These "Nikes"​If you're in the market for a new pair of running shoes, I have a recommendation for you: run as fast as you can in the opposite direction from these. I don't know who made these, but I'm pretty sure their product development meeting went something like this: "Okay, we need a running shoe that looks like a Nike, but is it a Nike? Absolutely not. Will it support your foot? No. Can you run in it? You can try. Should you try? Probably not."​The lack of support is truly a work of art, a masterpiece of structural failure. It feels less like I'm wearing a running shoe and more like I'm running on two very stylish, foot-shaped pillows. You know how some shoes have a heel cup to keep your foot in place? These have a heel suggestion, a gentle nudge that basically says, "Your foot should probably stay here, but hey, if it wants to slip around, that's cool too."​And let's talk about the midsole. I'm not a podiatrist, but I'm pretty sure a shoe's midsole is supposed to provide a stable foundation, not an expanding one. These shoes have a tragic flaw: the midsole has decided to spread out like a happy-go-lucky house guest who's gotten a little too comfortable on the couch. Every time I take a step, I can feel the shoe itself surrendering to the laws of physics, widening and flattening out under the sheer weight of my disappointment.​I waited too long to return them, a classic rookie mistake. I was too optimistic, hoping that with each run, they would somehow magically transform into the supportive shoes they were pretending to be. They did not. Instead, they just got worse, which is honestly impressive. So, would I purchase them again? Not unless I'm training for a clown marathon where oversized, floppy footwear is a requirement. Would I recommend them? Only to my worst enemy. You've been warned.

I gave these sneakers as a birthday present, and they were a total hit. The fit was just right, and they felt sturdy without being too bulky. Breathable, supportive — basically, everything you'd want in a sneaker.

I’ve worn a lot of different adidas sneakers over the years, and these X_PLR Paths are a really solid option if you’re looking for something casual and lightweight. They’re comfortable right out of the box — no break-in time needed — and the Cloudfoam cushioning does a good job for everyday walking and running errands.The color looks great in person — just a little more muted than it appeared online, which honestly I liked even better once I saw them. They’re really easy to pair with jeans or joggers.One heads-up: they’re more of a casual/lifestyle shoe than a hardcore running shoe. Fine for light workouts, but if you’re planning serious running, you might want something a little more performance-focused.Overall, really comfortable and clean-looking for everyday wear.

Size 12 fits great. No tie all toggle to loosen or pull tight. So far they are super comfortable. Great color and style also. 10/10 I'm going to order more in other colors. High five Amazon! Way to go

This is my 3rd pair of this model (Interact Run). This is my 2nd pair of the white/day-glo green logo model. The shoe just looks great. I get a lot of compliments on its looks.Fit: I wear a 9.5 Wide, typical shoe size. However, on my work out shoes I usually go up to a size 10. I need the extra toe box width. This size 10 feels a little tight to begin with, but it does stretch out pretty quickly. I did order a 10.5 on one pair and it opened up the toe box, but is a little loose.Durability: The tread is not very deep, so I find that I am wearing the grooves out in my major contact areas pretty quickly. I am getting about 90 days of everyday workout use before the certain areas are slick. The shoe is still very serviceable, so it gets relegated to a walking or casual shoe.Value: I could sometimes get this shoe for under $60. That for me is a great value. Similar shoes go for around $120 in my experience.I would highly recommend for an indoor gym / cross training shoe

Great shoes, worth the money. My son wore these shoes to Europe and comfortably walked 12 plus miles a day in them. Quality is amazing. Sizing is accurate, true to size.

I absolutely love these sneakers! The bright pink color is even more beautiful in person, and they make any outfit stand out. They are lightweight, breathable, and super comfortable to walk in. title: Under Armour Boys Grade School Assert 10
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes to be good quality, comfortable, and durable enough to last throughout the school year. They appreciate the style, with one customer noting the fun design on the bottom, and consider them a great everyday sneaker for kids, particularly active boys. The shoes receive positive feedback for their color and value for money. Regarding size, while some customers find them to be nice for wide feet, others mention they tend to run a little small.

Review.review: I recently purchased the Under Armour Kids' Grade School Assert 10 Sneakers for my child, and they are excellent! These sneakers are lightweight yet supportive, making them perfect for everyday wear, sports, and outdoor activities. The breathable mesh upper keeps feet cool, while the cushioned midsole provides comfort and shock absorption during running or play.The sneakers also have a durable rubber outsole that provides excellent traction, reducing the risk of slips during active play. The sleek design and modern style appeal to kids, and the shoes fit true to size, making them easy to wear for extended periods.Overall, the Assert 10 combines comfort, durability, and style, making it a reliable choice for active kids. They hold up well after repeated wear and are easy to clean, making them a great value for parents.Pros:Lightweight, breathable mesh upperCushioned midsole for comfort and shock absorptionDurable rubber outsole with good tractionSleek and modern design appealing to kidsTrue-to-size fit and easy to cleanCons:Minimal color options in some sizesLaces may require supervision for younger childrenOverall: The Under Armour Kids' Grade School Assert 10 Sneakers are comfortable, durable, and stylish, perfect for active kids who need reliable everyday footwear. Highly recommended!

Very nice! The color is light grey with baby pink combined! Super feminine so my daughter loves it! The holographic "H" is actually pretty! The inside is soft and fully cushioned! I love the ties because it holds the knot tight and secure. It doesn't glide at all and not very long. This fabric is breathable and yet durable!

Very happy with these sneakers! My son is 7 and extremely rough with shoes between running, playing and all the things, these shoes definitely hold up compared to other brands I’ve tried. He also walks on his tippy toes which puts more wear on the front of shoes but these hold up well! This style is one I’ll be sticking with and have used even when he was in the smaller sizes with the Velcro and not laces. They are reasonably priced, true to size and comfortable with no issues! Highly recommend because I know how hard it can be to find good sneakers for kids!

title: Nike Men's Free Metcon 6 Workout Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these workout shoes comfortable, stylish, and lightweight, with good stability that provides confidence during heavier lifts. Moreover, they appreciate the quality, with one customer noting the sock liner design for ankle support, and consider them the best all-purpose workout shoe. However, the fit receives mixed feedback - while some find them snug to put on, others mention they're hard to get on and off. Additionally, opinions about size vary, with some finding them suitable for wide feet while others note they run a bit small.

Review.review: I ordered the Nike Metcon 6 Free about a week ago, and I’ve been pleasantly surprised with the performance right from the start. The shoes are extremely comfortable, offering a secure yet flexible fit that adapts well during both lifting and conditioning workouts. What stood out the most is how easy they were to break in—practically no adjustment period was needed. Within the first couple of sessions, they already felt like a natural extension of my training routine.The breathability is another strong point; the mesh upper keeps my feet cool even during long, high-intensity workouts. The stability in the heel gives confidence under heavier lifts, while the forefoot remains flexible enough for sprints, jumps, and dynamic movements. It’s a rare balance of support and comfort that makes the Metcon 6 Free versatile for both strength and functional training.Overall, this shoe delivers on all fronts: comfort, stability, and ease of use. If you want a training shoe that won’t slow you down with a long break-in period, the Metcon 6 Free is a solid choice.
Lightweight and very comfortable. Fit is great.

This version of the Free Metcon (Version 6) is by far the best all-purpose workout shoe that I've ever used. I really put my workout sneakers through the ringer; using them 7-days a week for weight training and cardio (3.5 miles/day of incline treadmill). Aside from comfort, being lightweight, and accommodating wider feet (unlike version 5 of the same sneaker), what really stands out about these is their versatility. I've never had a workout sneaker (metcon, running sneaker, powerlifting shoe) that has provided ample stability to perform barbell squats while also being comfortable, flexible, and lightweight enough to do an hour of cardio in. I wish that they lasted me slightly longer than 5 months, but considering what I put them through, these are great value for the money. I've purchased 5 total pairs of these and would recommend to anyone for almost any application.

The Nike Metcon 6 is an excellent all around athletic, workout shoe because it provides good cushioning, stability, breathability and flexibility. Before purchasing these shoes for my Gold'sFit workout class, I used running shoes, but running shoes did not provide enough lateral support and stability during lifts and doing side to side movement. The Nike Metcon 6 feel much more stabile and confidently perform through a variety of activities. When I started looking at other people's shoes in the gym, I was surprised how many also also chose the Nike Metcon.
Light weight, comfortable and very stylish.

Previously, I had the gray and that was a great color too. I hope they keep makin' them. A bit pricy, but worth every penny. A well made, high quality shoe. Thanks, New balance!

I WANT to adore these shoes.  I have another pair of New Balance shoes that I DO adore, so ordered these with reckless abandon.  I wear this pair on my commute, which is 20 min of city walking each way.  The soles are great, very cushion-y - but the backs/heels TORE my heels apart for WEEKS.  Initially my fault for wearing no-show socks on the first time wearing these shoes, but even after weeks of walking, I still have issues.  I now wear higher no-show socks, but every couple of days, if the socks don't sit exactly right, the shoes still rub to the point of blisters.  It's almost as if the heel is TOO reinforced/stiff.  Blisters aside, they fit true to size, are SO cute, and very comfortable.

These are my absolute faves. I hope that NB will make these a STANDARD MODEL - they are perfect for mortons toe or folks with mortons neuromas- offering a great square toe box and incredible support that is not MUSHY like a lot of brands these days.  This is a solid shoe and it's also cute with dresses and wide leg jeans...

I am very happy with this purchase. I intend to keep the shoes & use them for the gym and PT. I am unsure If I will use them on the court for Pickleball however, or other sports however.  They seem more aesthetic than sports effective.  There is not much arch support. They are the same caliber as the Cole Haan  tennis shoes which are actually good & much better than Dooney & Burke which are definitely aesthetically designed.  The leather on the Nike is EXCELLENT.  Much better than the brands I just mentioned.  I could tell by the way they buckled  to conform to the crease of my foot on the first wear without breaking. They will definitely hold up a lot longer than most brands I have had. I am happy with the fit & was able to adjust the laces to fit the extra width of my feet satisfactorily which is not always the case.  Some brands cut the width short @ the base & before letting the shoe widen out to save $.  Nike did not do this & I was very happy with being able to adjust the fit.  The heel padding is EXCELLENT ALSO. This shoe fit durability, quality, sizing, fit, heel padding, leather quality, ease of cleaning, true to description & aesthetically pleasing! The only reason I did not give it a 5 is that These qualities were all so good that the arch support did not compare to their definite 5 rating.  So what could have been an overall 5 shoe in every category got uncharacteristically, almost unfairly downgraded to a 4 because of one  category…. Arch support.  If all shoes could say that they would be 5’s. I guess this is a rather critical review if all the categories are 5 except one.  I hope this is helpful.

title: Under Armour Unisex Adult Lockdown 7 Basketball Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these basketball shoes well-made and comfortable, with one noting they feel fine after just 5 minutes of walking. Customers disagree on whether the shoes run true to size or are slightly small. The durability receives mixed reviews, with some customers finding them durable for long-term use.

Review.review: These Under Armour sneakers quickly became one of my favorite pairs of shoes. They’re very comfortable right out of the box, with good cushioning and support that make them easy to wear all day. On top of that, the design is sleek and modern, so they work just as well for casual wear as they do for workouts.I also appreciate the variety of styles and sizes that Under Armour offers. It made it easy to find the right fit and a look I really like. The build quality feels solid too — the stitching, materials, and overall construction seem durable, which gives me confidence they’ll hold up well over time.Overall, a great mix of comfort, style, and durability. Definitely recommend these sneakers!

These sneakers are a reflection of quality. They're a great product, and for me, what stands out most is their comfort. They're very comfortable, especially in the back of the foot, which is very padded. They're also made with excellent materials and seem durable for the long term. Overall, the sneakers are well-made and very light. They don't feel heavy at all; all the details are well-cared for.As for aesthetics, it depends more on each person's personal taste, but I loved the very modern and youthful design. In general, products from this brand tend to have good designs. As for the size, it was exactly what I ordered. I think you should follow the advice given in the product description. For example, I'm a size 10.5, but they advise ordering one size larger than your normal size. So, I ordered size 11.5, and the truth is, they fit me very well. For my first online shoe purchase, it was a good idea, since that's one of the disadvantages of buying shoes online: not being able to test if they fit properly.The price I paid for what I got was fair, and I would definitely buy them again.

I love these sneakers.  I bought these for tennis. When I saw them, I thought they were cute and they really are. They are well made, they fit good, true to size, comfortable and has a good arch support. I'm a woman,  I like men's  shoe for playing tennis so I bought a 9.5 in these. I'm a ladies 11 usually. I'm very pleased with this purchase and I'm already looking for another pair in a different color. So happy with this purchase..
Great sneaker wish they had i little more arch support but that is me personally.  Other then that great price and good quality.

title: Saucony Women's Cohesion 14 Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one describing them as feeling like walking on a cloud, and appreciate their quality and good-looking design. The fit and size receive mixed feedback - while some say the fit is great, others find them too narrow, and many note the toe box is too small. The support and durability also get mixed reviews, with some praising the arch support while others report issues with the sole coming apart, and several customers mention their feet hurting.

Review.review: Perfect for my wide forefoot and high arch. The fit is snug but feels comfortable. I'd rather have this close fit and support than a loosey-goosey fit that I was getting in the Saucony Excursion terrain shoe in the same size. I also like the heel cuff, the exursion was skimpy on the padding and got lumpy too quickly. These are overall very nicely made and nice looking.
These are good shoes. They have gone though many washes and are still holding strong. They are comfortable and not heavy.

I should have read the reviews before purchasing.  I've been buying saucony shoes for 20 years, including others in the cohesion line, and always gotten the same size. These are ~0.5 size too small. I was hoping they would stretch out over time but they're hurting my toes too much and I can't stand to wear them.
These sneakers are my go-to. So comfortable and have great cushion. There's nothing I can't do in these sneakers!

I have worn Saucony running shoes for 40 years, and have never gone wrong with a pair. My first pair was orange and garish, but on sale at an outlet. I was a poor college student training for a 1/2 marathon, and bought what I could afford. From then on it was love at first step. Like all the other Saucony shoes in my past, the Saucony Women's Cohesion 14 Road Running Shoe (what a mouthful) is a delight. I normally wear a women's size 9, but have a wide foot, so ordered a 9.5 US in this shoe. Good fit, good arch support, no rub at the back of the heel, nice stability against ankle roll on irregular terrain, nice sole cushion for heel strike and follow through, good flexibility at the bend of the metatarsal-toe joints. Good breathability...no sweaty feet after prolonged use (I prefer wearing socks). I'm not the fastest runner/walker on the block anymore, but these shoes still allow me to get out there and try. Plus, the black/grey/blue color scheme is attractive, even when wearing with casual slacks or jeans.Update, several years later: My previous pair of Saucony Cohesion 14 shoes are ready to retire. After regular use for several years, the front sole is beginning to peel back and my great toes are pushing forward in the toe box while running, wearing this area thin. I lace the shoes loose to help widen the toe box, and agree with other reviewers that the Saucony toe box on this shoe is more narrow than in past decades (I've worn Saucony brand for running since early 1980's). To adjust for the narrower design and different manufacturer, I ordered up from a size 9.5 to a size 10. I was skeptical that a size 10 would work because I normally wear a 9.5 running shoe. Right out of the box the new size 10's feel ok. My great toes are a full index-finger width back from the front end of the toe (see attached photo). This is comfortable. However the heel area is a bit loose compared to the size 9.5. I wear socks with these shoes, but as yet don't know if the heel will slip when running uneven terrain. The photos show the old size 9.5 (grey/blue) shoes compared to the new size 10 (blue/light blue) shoes. The length difference is barely perceptible, and the new shoes show the slimmer toe box. Just be aware that you may want to size up or go to a wide size for comfort. Still a good shoe for the price.
Not the usual standard ofSaucony. Fit of the shoes were uncomfortable. Seemed smaller and tighter than normal. Padding in left shoe heel bunched and made it difficult to put on. Wouldn’t recommend.

I really like this brand and the fit of it. Tested by my chiropractor for me and I stand balanced with them on. So I continue to buy the same product every time I need to replace the sneakers that I have worn out.

Par arch support.... ended up putting in additional support for all day Vet Nurse milage. Tread had peeled off on one foot, already, wearing for less than 60 days, I thought would be sturdier. Nice shoe for the price of shoes these days. My size 10 feet don't look ginormous. Pink color is not bright bubble gum pink, so that's nice.

Review.review: I bought these Air Jordan 1 Mid sneakers as a birthday gift for my husband, and he absolutely loved them! I recently picked up a pair of the Nike Men's Air Jordans in that stunning light blue color with white and black accents, and I couldn't be happier. These shoes are an absolute showstopper! The color combination is clean, bold, and modern. The light blue gives off a cool, fresh vibe while the black and white details add the perfect contrast for a sleek finish.Comfort-wise, they're exactly what you'd expect from Jordans — top-tier. The cushioning feels great for everyday wear or even on the days we spend too much time on our feet, and the support around the ankle gives me confidence in every step. You can tell the quality is there, from the stitching to the materials used.Whether you're a sneakerhead, a casual wearer, or just looking for a standout pair of kicks, these Jordans deliver. I’ve gotten compliments every time I wear them. Stylish, comfortable, and built to last — what more could you want?Highly recommend!

When I purchased these red, black, and white Jordan 1s in 2024, they fulfilled every expectation I had.  The color scheme is striking yet still complements practically every ensemble, striking the ideal mix between traditional and contemporary design.  The stitching is excellent, and the leather feels high-end.They provide excellent ankle support and the ideal amount of cushioning, making them unexpectedly comfortable for all-day usage.  Every time I wear them out, I get compliments.  These Jordans are a no-brainer whether you're a sneakerhead or simply want a dependable pair of shoes that draw attention.Ten out of ten for comfort and style.

*PUMA Men's Voltaic Evo Running Shoe***In the world of athletic footwear, finding the perfect balance between comfort, performance, and style can often feel like an impossible feat. But the *PUMA Men’s Voltaic Evo Running Shoe* rises to the occasion, offering an unparalleled combination of cutting-edge technology, sleek design, and all-day comfort that makes every run feel like a victory lap. Whether you're a seasoned marathoner, a weekend jogger, or someone just starting to get active, these shoes are engineered to take your performance to the next level, without compromising on style or durability.**The Perfect Fusion of Performance and Comfort**From the moment you lace up the *PUMA Voltaic Evo Running Shoe*, you’ll immediately notice the difference. It’s not just a running shoe—it’s a performance-enhancing tool that’s been meticulously designed to provide maximum support, flexibility, and comfort with every stride.At the heart of this shoe is its cutting-edge *IGNITE foam technology*, which offers exceptional energy return, cushioning, and responsiveness. The foam adapts to the unique needs of your foot, offering a soft yet springy feel that propels you forward with each step. Whether you’re running on pavement, trails, or even hopping onto a treadmill, the *Voltaic Evo* makes every footfall feel light and effortless, while still providing the support you need to push through the toughest runs.**Lightweight Yet Durable: Built for Long-Lasting Performance**One of the standout features of the *PUMA Voltaic Evo* is its **lightweight construction**. This shoe won’t weigh you down or slow you up, making it perfect for both long-distance runners and those who want a fast, responsive feel. The lightweight design means you can run longer without experiencing the fatigue that comes with heavier footwear, while the sturdy build ensures that the shoes will hold up even through intense training sessions.Despite being incredibly light, the *Voltaic Evo* doesn’t sacrifice durability. PUMA has designed these shoes with a reinforced **rubber outsole** that provides exceptional traction and grip. Whether you're running on slick surfaces or tackling uneven ground, you can rely on the shoe’s robust traction to keep you steady. The shoe’s outsole is crafted with strategically placed grooves to offer better flexibility, ensuring that your foot moves naturally while still providing grip where you need it most.**Breathable and Supportive: The Ultimate Fit**The *PUMA Voltaic Evo Running Shoe* is all about keeping your feet cool and comfortable, no matter how intense your workout may be. The engineered mesh upper ensures that your feet stay well-ventilated, reducing heat buildup and moisture during long runs. Say goodbye to uncomfortable sweaty feet and hello to a breathable, dry, and comfortable running experience.The shoe also features a **sock-like fit**, which provides a snug yet flexible embrace for your foot, preventing slipping or uncomfortable rubbing. The padded collar and heel counter offer extra support around the ankle, ensuring a secure and customized fit that adapts to the shape of your foot, giving you stability and confidence in every stride.**Sleek Design Meets Bold Innovation**Let’s talk about style. The *PUMA Voltaic Evo* doesn't just perform—it makes a statement. With its sleek, modern design, this shoe is sure to turn heads wherever you go. Available in a variety of colorways, you’ll find a look that suits your personal style—whether you prefer bold, eye-catching hues or more understated, minimalist tones. The distinctive PUMA branding adds a touch of flair, while the streamlined silhouette ensures that this shoe looks as good as it feels.Whether you’re using it as your go-to running shoe or as a stylish everyday sneaker, the *Voltaic Evo* offers a dynamic, athletic aesthetic that fits seamlessly into any wardrobe. Its design is as much about functionality as it is about making a bold statement.**Breath-Taking Comfort: Ideal for All-Day Wear**While the *PUMA Voltaic Evo* is undeniably a performance shoe, it’s also built for comfort throughout the entire day. The shoe’s cushioning system ensures that every step feels plush, while the flexible construction allows for natural movement, whether you're sprinting at full speed or walking casually around town. Its combination of breathability, support, and responsive cushioning means you can wear these shoes for hours on end without experiencing discomfort or fatigue. So whether you’re out on a run or running errands, the *Voltaic Evo* will keep your feet feeling fresh and comfortable all day long.**Perfect for Every Runner**The *PUMA Men’s Voltaic Evo Running Shoe* is engineered to meet the needs of every runner, from the beginner to the seasoned marathoner. Its combination of lightweight comfort, high-performance cushioning, and superior traction makes it an ideal choice for anyone who’s serious about improving their athletic performance. Whether you're hitting the pavement, the track, or your local trails, these shoes provide the right mix of support and flexibility to help you perform at your peak.For those who value a responsive and energetic feel underfoot, the *Voltaic Evo* excels. The shoe’s **IGNITE foam** cushioning system ensures that energy from each stride is returned, propelling you forward without requiring excessive effort. Its **outstanding traction** allows you to take on various surfaces with confidence, and its **sock-like fit** ensures that you’ll have stability without the risk of blisters or discomfort.**Final Verdict: The Running Shoe of the Future**In conclusion, the *PUMA Men’s Voltaic Evo Running Shoe* is a masterpiece of design and performance, blending cutting-edge technology with sleek aesthetics to deliver a shoe that’s not only functional but also a joy to wear. Its lightweight build, superior cushioning, and durable construction make it the perfect companion for runners of all levels, offering both comfort and performance in one dynamic package. The breathable upper, sock-like fit, and exceptional traction all come together to make the *Voltaic Evo* a truly exceptional choice for anyone who’s serious about their athletic endeavors.If you’re in the market for a running shoe that can keep up with your pace while still turning heads, look no further than the *PUMA Voltaic Evo Running Shoe*. Whether you’re racing down the track, running errands, or simply enjoying a leisurely jog, these shoes provide the comfort, support, and style you need to take on the day with confidence. Once you slip your feet into these shoes, you’ll quickly realize that the *Voltaic Evo* isn’t just a running shoe—it’s an experience.

Review.review: These PUMA Riaze Prowl trainers are exactly what I was hoping for. The fit is true to size and super comfortable, even after wearing them all day. They’re also lightweight, so I don’t feel weighed down.On top of that, they look great. Sleek design, clean lines, and they go with just about everything from workout gear to jeans. I’ve already gotten compliments on them. If you want sneakers that feel good and look good, these are a win.
They are easy to slip on and do not rub the heels. They are lightweight with a decent heel height. They are great quality and have good support. They are pretty comfortable and have a good design.

My wife is a neonatologist, constantly on her feet and often sprinting to emergencies. These PUMA Riaze Prowl trainers are her new favorite. The comfort is unmatched, with cushioning that supports long shifts and sudden movement. The color scheme is subtle yet unique, adding a splash of personality without being loud. She’s worn them for work, travel, and casual outings, and they’ve held up beautifully. If you need shoes that combine performance with style, these are a standout.

I'm disappointed because this relationship started off really well. The shoes are adorable! Love the bright colors, nothing too loud, but definitely noticeable.  This is a very comfortable shoe with a Gel insert, so your steps are pretty cushioned and light. H O W E V E R, THERE ARE TOE-HOLES ON MY SHOES NOW!  To get an idea of the usage for wear and tear, I've used these shoes at the gym 5 days a week for 1.5 hrs for only the past 6 weeks - with only 25 minutes of that being cardio. I do not use these shoes for any other purpose.  I'm upset because these shoes wore out already! I'm not sure what type of resistance sneakers should withstand, but I can tell you that today I have shin splints (which I believe is because the insert has worn down) and I just noticed these toe holes!  For the record, I'm well groom with mani-pedi's so my toenail did not bust open this shoe!If you need this for the gym I do not suggest it unless you are ok with the life span and maybe alternate shoes.  However, if you just want a comfortable, cute set of kicks to hang out it, then you should show these guys off :)I get a lot of compliments!

These shoes feel comfortable and durable. I will definitely buy them again. I will say that I’m used to wearing cowboy boots and had to stop wearing them all the time due to medical reasons. But I am used to leather and leather-like items. But if you are not, these might feel warm if you wear them on a hot day. They have some airflow but they definitely aren’t like a running shoe for air flow. Cowboy boots allow no air flow so I’m used to it and I don’t have a complaint about it. They also have a strong leather smell when they are new, which is not my favorite smell but I’m used to it with cowboy boots again. But if you don’t like the smell of leather it might be overpowering at first. Overall nice shoes that are comfortable and look nice that I wear everywhere I go now. They fit well and don’t seem to untie themselves constantly like some shoes seem to. I wear them in wet grass all the time and they are waterproof in short grass. They have breathing holes across the top so if you step in a puddle that is over your shoe it will likely fill from the top and then you would have to take it off and actually dump it. Overall, great shoes.

title: PUMA Men's Softride Enzo 5 Cross Training Shoes Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these cross trainers comfortable, with one noting their feet don't hurt 24/7, and appreciate their build quality, value for money, and perfect fit. They receive positive feedback for their style and durability, with one customer mentioning they're great for walking and running. The slip-on feature and sturdiness receive mixed reviews, with some finding them strong while others report eyelets breaking after a month of use.

Review.review: As someone who's already bought and loved a pair of these, I can confidently say the PUMA Men's Softride Enzo 5 Cross Training shoes are a fantastic investment, so much so that this is my second pair. I've found them to be an excellent all-around shoe that provides comfort, style, and solid performance without a hefty price tag.​The "Softride" foam is the real star of the show here. The cushioning is incredibly comfortable right out of the box and provides a plush, responsive feel whether I'm walking, doing light jogging, or working out. It's a noticeable upgrade from many other shoes in this price range. The support and stability are also great for cross-training. The TPU cage gives you a locked-down feel, and the zoned rubber outsole provides reliable traction on a variety of surfaces, from gym floors to pavement.​Beyond the performance, they simply look great. The sleek design and clean lines make them versatile enough to wear not just for the gym but also for casual everyday use. The fact that PUMA uses at least 30% recycled materials in the upper is a nice bonus and something I appreciate as a consumer.​The long-lasting comfort is why I keep coming back to this model. My first pair held up incredibly well to daily use, and I expect the same from this one. If you're looking for a shoe that's comfortable for all-day wear, performs well during a workout, and doesn't break the bank, the PUMA Softride Enzo 5 is a perfect choice. Highly recommended.

Review.review: I recently picked up the PUMA Men's Viz Runner Sneakers, and they’ve quickly become my favorite pair for both workouts and casual wear. The design is sleek and modern, with just the right amount of flair to make them stand out without being too flashy. They’ve received a lot of compliments!Comfort-wise, these sneakers are fantastic. The cushioning provides great support, especially during long runs or extended periods of walking. The fit is snug but not too tight, and the breathable material keeps my feet cool, even during intense workouts.The durability of these shoes is impressive. After several weeks of regular use, they still look and feel like new. The grip on the sole offers solid traction, whether I’m on the treadmill, the trail, or just running errands around town.Overall, the PUMA Viz Runner Sneaker is a great choice for anyone looking for a stylish, comfortable, and reliable shoe. With their combination of style, comfort, and performance, they definitely deserve their 4.5-star rating. Highly recommended!

title: PUMA Mens Reflect Lite TrailSneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, with one noting they don't rub against the ankle bone, and appreciate their fit and style that looks like a trail shoe. The shoes receive positive feedback for their feel, durability, and stability, with one customer mentioning they work well for both sports and casual wear. Customers disagree on the sizing.

Review.review: I bought these shoes to get my feet wet in trail hiking / running.  I was and still am pleasantly surprised by what feels like a shoe that will hold up for the next 6 to 12 months at minimum as I put them through their paces ... not necessarily with what I had originally planned (trail hiking and running), but more so everyday life (work and play). I've tried some of the highest rated and more expensive shoes.  From a beginner running (9.5 min mile) standpoint and a person who tries to eat right and exercise everyday I would say that these shoes are a perfect fit for anybody's everyday activities. I work long 12-hour shifts and I'm constantly on my feet.  These shoes stood up to the time duration and did not cause my feet any discomfort.  They have just the right amount of padding, firmness and stability so that you feel confident with every step you take.  Granted I did not test these shoes in wet environments on varying surfaces (specifically smooth).  These shoes are said to be waterproof however I would probably caution people with regard to that and just say water resistant.  This is my first pair of Pumas and I am truly impressed.  For treadmill running I have a pair of Adizero Evos which are also fantastic but seem to be more environmentally limited due to their lack of semi cleated soles for outdoor running.  I'd highly recommend these Pumas as an everyday shoe.  They have served me well in varying environments including the rough sidewalks/streets of Tijuana MX.

I recommend ordering a half-size up In comparison to Nikes and Adidas. I wear a 10.5-11 in Adidas and Nikes and had to return a size 11 pair of these to get an 11.5 pair. The 11.5s are slightly snug and feel and look great. Should break in nicely but will update if not. First time buying Pumas and pleased so far.

Review.review: I have had similar mesh type shoes and they stretch with a break in. First impression was "gee I wish the squishy foam on the bottom was twice as thick."  The glue on the rubber doo dad above the toes is visible. I bought these for work. Hard dang work. I am talking 8,10,12 hour days on my feet and sometimes, 8am to 10pm. And my feet will swell. They look rather amazing. I will wear these this coming week, (a 50 hr week) and update as to wear, stretch, fit and how they feel. UPDATE: I have been wearing them over a month now.  These relaxed a little bit. I need to wear thin socks, rather than thick athletic type socks. They are holding up great and I am able to wear them for full shifts and more with no pain. I still wish they had a thicker foam sole. I think if I got a 9.5 and threw in some inserts They would probably be even more comfy.
Durable, comfortable support, long-lasting for a lot of use, incredibly light, and fashionable. And let's be real--Black shoes go with anything!

title: PUMA Men's Caven 2.0 Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers to be of good quality with a retro-inspired silhouette and versatile color options. They are comfortable, offer a great fit, and provide good value for the price. Customers disagree on the sizing, with several noting they run too small and are narrow in width. Review.review: I recently wore the PUMA Caven 2.0 Men’s Sneakers for several weeks to test their comfort, fit, and style. Here’s my honest experience:Clean, classic designThe Caven 2.0 features a sleek, retro-inspired silhouette that pairs easily with jeans, joggers, or casual shorts. The minimalist style works for both casual outings and everyday wear.Comfortable cushioningThe padded insole and soft lining provide excellent comfort for all-day use. Whether walking around the city or running errands, my feet stayed comfortable and supported.Durable constructionThe upper materials feel sturdy and well-made. The outsole offers good traction and grip on a variety of surfaces, adding to the overall durability.Versatile color optionsThe neutral tones and simple design make them easy to match with different outfits. They’re a reliable go-to sneaker for any wardrobe.Lightweight feelDespite their sturdy build, these sneakers are surprisingly lightweight, reducing foot fatigue over long periods.Sizing runs slightly narrowIf you have wider feet, you may want to size up or try them on first for the best fit.Break-in periodThe leather-like material may feel a bit stiff initially. After a couple of wears, the sneakers soften and become more flexible.Not for high-performance sportsWhile great for everyday wear and light activity, these sneakers are designed more for lifestyle use than intense athletic performance.

He wears them all day almost every day of the week! They were a great price and definitely on trend for this school year!

After some research, excluding Nike that I no longer care to patronize, I ordered this pair of Pumas and a pair of Adidas.  Both had very good reviews by credible sources. After trying on both I went with these and have worn while walking the past couple weeks. title: PUMA Mens Redon Bungee Slip On Sneakers Shoes Casual - White
Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable, lightweight, and easy to slip on, with one customer noting they're excellent for golf. The style receives positive feedback, and customers like the fit, with one mentioning they're not too narrow. The laces receive mixed reviews - while one customer appreciates the bungee cord design, others note that the elastic straps are not adjustable.

Review.review: I just received these Puma Redon Bungee shoes today and they're exactly what I was looking for.Let me begin by debunking a few of the misconceptions about this shoe you'll find in other reviews here.  Apparently more than a few people did NOT realize what they were buying.  I saw complaints about the thin midsoles being uncomfortable to walk in all day.  Umm yeah, they weren't designed for walking.  And someone was complaining about the lack of arch support.  Once again, that is intentional.  This wasn't designed as a running shoe or a trainer.This is designed as a driving shoe.  It minimizes bulk.  So no bloated padded midsole like running shoes.  And outsole wear is not really a top priority so, the rubber outsole is thin too.  Also the sole is flat with zero heel drop unlike most running shoes.  And there is basically zero arch support on purpose.The reason for taking out all those "features" is to make a shoe that fits like a second skin.  Light, tightly fitted to your foot with no excess bulk to give you maximum space around the clutch, brake, and gas pedals in the car's footwell.  And that thin, flat midsole and outsole is designed to give you maximum feel of the pedals under your foot.  The rubber outsole is curved up the heel of the shoe for a reason, to prevent slip in your right foot when you are trying to heel and toe downshift a manual transmission.Can you wear these to walk from the car to a restaurant?  Sure.  Do you want to wear them to walk all day or for a 7 mile run?  No way.  These are a specialty shoe.  They are great on long drives.Puma sells to motorsports unlike most sneaker brands.  They have at least 3 other motorsports shoe lines, the Speed Cat, Drift Cat, and Future Cat.  But the Redon is the only one (I think) to offer a slip on bungee lace design.  I'm used to leather driving loafers for the street but those don't really look right with jeans or shorts.  So, I bought the Redon's as a casual driving shoe with the same slip on convenience a my leather driving loafers.  And truth be told, I'll use them as my house slippers too because they are easy to slide into or pop off.Another thing that may confuse people is that Puma also makes shoes for martial arts fighting on mats.  The Redon has a much of the same look as their fighting shoes.  Minimal bulk, skin tight fit, flat soles, rubber on the outside of the heel, light weight.  So it looks a lot like a fighting shoe which is another highly specialized product.So the Redon is not your usual casual sneaker or a running shoe.  But it's a really nice driving shoe that can be worn to walk a few blocks with no problem.  I like the clean minimalist look a lot.  I like the light weight.  I love the slip on feature.  And I love the thin sole that gives me great "feel" of what's under my foot.Another complaint I've seen here is the fit.  I wear a size 11D (medium width) in a running shoe so that's what I bought in the Redon Bungee.  They fit me fine in both length and width.  I didn't need to size up or down.  They are snug but easy to step into.  They feel secure on my feet but not so tight that they're annoying or painful.  But I'd advise anyone with wide feet to think twice about these.  They are made snug to work with the bungee lacing system.So all in all, I'm really happy with these driving shoes for the street.  At $40 they're a great value.  I may ditch leather driving moccasins altogether.
True to sizeVery comfortableLow profile / stylishOrdered a second pair

For THIS they are great.The people wearing them for fashion, or work must be young and don’t realize yet that their feet, shins, and legs will hurt.They aren’t even grossly overpriced, that is refreshing!

I contacted Puma because I wanted to return them and have a replacement pair sent, but they informed me they had "determined that there is no defect with this specific product that would qualify for a refund or reship." When I initially contacted them, they replied on October 22nd saying they would get back to me in 7-10 business days. They actually made me wait three full weeks (or 15 business days) before responding tonight (November 12th). All in all, this has been terrible customer service.As a big fan of Puma footwear (Speedcats in particular), and having worn nothing but them for the past decade, this experience has made me rethink my brand loyalty.I cannot recommend this shoe or brand in good faith to anyone.
