Review.review: I recently wore the PUMA Caven 2.0 Men’s Sneakers for several weeks to test their comfort, fit, and style. Here’s my honest experience:Clean, classic designThe Caven 2.0 features a sleek, retro-inspired silhouette that pairs easily with jeans, joggers, or casual shorts. The minimalist style works for both casual outings and everyday wear.Comfortable cushioningThe padded insole and soft lining provide excellent comfort for all-day use. Whether walking around the city or running errands, my feet stayed comfortable and supported.Durable constructionThe upper materials feel sturdy and well-made. The outsole offers good traction and grip on a variety of surfaces, adding to the overall durability.Versatile color optionsThe neutral tones and simple design make them easy to match with different outfits. They’re a reliable go-to sneaker for any wardrobe.Lightweight feelDespite their sturdy build, these sneakers are surprisingly lightweight, reducing foot fatigue over long periods.Sizing runs slightly narrowIf you have wider feet, you may want to size up or try them on first for the best fit.Break-in periodThe leather-like material may feel a bit stiff initially. After a couple of wears, the sneakers soften and become more flexible.Not for high-performance sportsWhile great for everyday wear and light activity, these sneakers are designed more for lifestyle use than intense athletic performance.

title: Under Armour Men's Charged Assert 9 Running Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these running shoes comfortable, well-designed, and lightweight, offering good value for money. They appreciate the fit, with one customer noting they're available in wide sizes. The durability receives mixed feedback - while some say they're holding up great, others report they wear down quickly. The sizing is also mixed, with some finding them true to size while others say they run small.

Review.review: Honestly one of the best shoes on the market for wide foot people, if your looking to snag a simple set of running sneakers, in my opinion. Here's some in-depth info along with  pro's and con's:TLDR: Great quality shoes for the price, and easy to clean. Recommend to beginner and intermediate runners/hikers, experts may be willing to pay more money for increase of quality.PROs:- Perfect Fit. I usually wear 9.0 wide (USA), so that is what I ordered and it fit perfectly.- Comfort and Ease. I like how comfortable they are and they are easy to slip on and off (if you wish) by the use of the heel pull tab. The tab also prevents the heel from getting bunched in or broken when putting on the shoes, which was a frequent problem with some other brands I have owned in the past.- Easy to Clean, Quality Mesh. I have seen some reviews saying these shoes wear out easily or the mesh is easier to damage. YMMV but I didn't seem to have this issue and I've had these shoes for about a year. IMO I find the mesh to be much more durable than the cloth mesh most sports shoes have these days and much easier to clean, which is essential for anyone like myself, who often hikes or runs in forestry/mud.- Above Average Quality. As for the year timeframe, the 1st set was about 8 months of extreme use, then I purchased a 2nd pair which I've had for about 3 months now. This may seem like a short timeframe to some but for me, I usually have to change shoes every 6 months or less if they are lower quality because they get a lot of mileage and use. I still have the 1st set which I use as "lawn mowing shoes", as they are still usable but the tread does not get much grip/traction anymore for running. I liked them enough to buy that 2nd pair instead of some other brand/model.- Decent Arch Support and Sole Tread. You will find other shoes with the same or better, but I didn't see many that were this cheap in price.- Part of Amazon's "Try Before You Buy". Free try-ons. You can take up to 6 days to decide whether to keep/return if you wish, and only be charged if not returned by the 7th day. Day 1 is the day they are delivered.- Uniform in Color. The shoe currently comes in all-black or all-white, including the logo. YMMV but this is a pro for me due to work restrictions requiring all-black shoes, so I can also wear them leisurely at work if I choose (I'm a mechanic). Great for anyone with the same issue, or military, etc.CONs:- Not the most expert/elite quality shoe out there, but will definitely check most people's boxes for average needs, imo.- Cost is higher than one might desire for just simple leisure shoes. But as an avid runner, the price is about average. However, they are usually on sale. My 1st set was around 40% off which dropped it from $70-something to $43, which was worth it for me. 2nd set was about 20% off. Winter holiday seems to be the best time for sales price.- Tread pattern is smooth and circular, instead of rigid and square/triangle, in case that matters to you (in regards to rock climbing etc)Overall I was surprisingly satisfied with this shoe model personally, but your mileage may vary.

Under armour shoes are stylish, comfortable and durable. My grandson is 10 and wears an 11 1/2 men's shoes. These are the only brand shoes that holds up to the hard playing. Tried Nikes but they came apart after a couple weeks wear. I'm under armour for life. They stay clean, light weight, easy on and stylish! Highly recommend!

I ordered multiple Brooks to try on and none was a truly good fit.I'm going to be doing a lot of walking, so I may purchase an additional insert but for everyday wear they are more than adequate without an insert.I'm happy to find a new brand, that has a dependable sizing system.Shoe quality:The quality appears to be goodArch support:arch support is goodMaterial thickness:SubstantialColor:blackSlip resistance:hopefully good I haven't been able to test drive in wet surfaces yetLightweight:yes, lightweight

TLDR: Excellent lifestyle sneakers, but strictly for walking or casual use. Not built for athletic performance.These sneakers are stylish and incredibly comfortable — for walking and everyday casual wear. The leather upper gives them a premium look, and the overall construction feels solid and well-made. They work perfectly as lifestyle shoes and are great for running errands, light strolling, or just pairing with a laid-back outfit.However, do not buy these for running or high-impact activities. They’re quite heavy and have an extremely soft, squishy sole that offers little to no responsiveness or support for running. Attempting to run in them feels unstable and could potentially lead to injury due to the lack of proper support and cushioning dynamics for that kind of movement.

Customer_say: Customers find these sneakers comfortable. The fit and quality receive mixed feedback.

Review.review: I needed a good-looking black pair of sneakers.  I wanted them to be of quality, comfortable and not be cheap.  I think I found them.I have owned many Puma sneakers.  They were extremely popular in the late 70's and early 80's.  The design, fit and quality were really good.  But, somehow, they simply stopped making a great shoe, and the ones after the above time period were poor quality, looked cheap, were cheap, and ugly.  Not made nor designed for a man; more or less for a teenager and someone in their early 20's.  It was hard to find a classic Puma.  After searching, I did.They arrived today.  Perfect fit, comfortable, and a good-looking sleek, black pair of sneakers.I didn't buy these to rock climb, go jogging or for hiking etc.  I bought these for a casual sneaker: go to the gym, wear around sneaker.  Concerning the durability, I will have to wait and see.  If they last a few years, then I will be fine with that.  I suspect they will last longer because I have other sneakers for other type of wear.If you want a classic, clean looking, black pair of leather sneakers, with all the above I described, consider these.By the way, the size was perfect.

What can you say about such a timeless and classic tennis shoe. I'm not sure of the type suede they are made of but it wears hard resists water and bleeding and cleans up nicely.These shoes have been around for decades , back when the tennis shoe was sold and made for playing tennis. Now they are much of a statement of your style as they are their utility.From gangsters to Lady Gaga This puma classic looks as good with the Mobsters velor tracksuit to a faded pair of Levi 501s on Sunday mornings.Construction Wise it's a lot of shoe for the money they wear hard and long. the soles are non-marring, the uppers glued and stitched. The matching color laces laces are extra wide and probably will last as long as the shoe itself, mine came with a pair of extra white laces should you not like the colored laces that they are shipped with.i wear a size 13 shoe , all Nikes are too narrow for me and some others such as Skechers are sometimes too wide this Puma seems true to size in this form.I have had a pair of the non classic leather tennis shoes that were a little bit narrow and constricted at the toe.In all fairness these fit perfect. Priced Right at $60 delivered on Amazon prime they come in several colors I'm sure you'll be pleased with whatever you choose,  so if you're on the fence get them you won't regret it.Warm regardsy Jerry and Honeycutt Jr.

I hate buying a pair of sneakers online that seem like such a great bargain, then they come in the mail and seem stiff, without any comfortable padding, and they just seem like terrible knock offs. I mean, the inside bottom sole isn't cushioned at all, and the sides walls of the sneaker aren't soft or cushioned at all either. Then it hits you, this is why these sneakers were cheap. BUT...these Pumas are not those cheaply made ones. The look great, they are truly classic Puma suede, and feel awesome on my feet. They are soft and padded nicely on the inside around the ankle and on the sole. As I stated in the headline, for $29.99, I should have bought multiple pairs! I love the grey/white look. I was watching these last year, and they dropped from $60 to $39. I wanted to purchase them last year, but didn't, and I was heart broken to see later that the price jumped back up to $60. My wife and I were sitting on the couch before this past Christmas, and she pointed out to me, "aren't these the sneakers you were looking at awhile ago?" She pointed out the incredible $29.99 price drop, and I "clicked to buy" immediately! If they offer them in other colors, still at that price, I might just get more!  In case you are wondering, I highly recommend these to any Puma lover, or anyone who loves great sneakers.  **Please note, I marked that these fit as expected. They fit as expected for a Puma sneaker. I have wide D sized foot. Pumas run a wee bit on the narrow side. These still fit great though**

Review.review: I have five pair of these shoes in different colors and they are, for me, the perfect shoe. They are comfortable for walking, standing, and give all day comfort. I am 5'10 175 lbs and wear a 10 medium. They fit true to size for me. I've worn them for about twelve hours on some days and never had a thought about them. They give great feedback while driving. I have a Porsche six speed and these are great driving shoes. I find the sole to have the perfect balance between to much and not enough cushion. Usually you get one or the other, but these shoes give both. I don't find them to slip on any surface but that's not to say they don't, I just haven't found that surface. I have been wearing them for about six months.

My 80yr old Dad prefers this style of Puma shoes. He says they help his feet feel better (he has nerve pain). I believe they help with compression without being too tight. This is his second pair. Length sizes run normally, although they are more narrow than most sneakers.

Honestly, the shoe looks great on my screen, but when it arrived, The Color appears more like a burgundy or deep red, not what I expected visually.  The Red is more toned down than I expected - it could stand to be a few shades lighter IMHO - I have multiple Puma shoes with Red, and this is definitely darker in appearance than the others;  I'm not sure that I'm going to keep them - I'm on the fence with this color.  Decisions, Decisions, I dunno?? - The jury is still out. :)

If I could give this product zero stars I would. It is by far the most ahoying shoes I have ever had. I have bought this brand of shoos over the years and never had the annoying problem that I have with the left shoe. The tongue of the shoe keeps sliding right until it is under my left foot creating an uncomfortable lump. I have tried everything including pushing it to the right when I put it on and it still slides over to the left and under the sole of my left foot. Too bad it is past the time when I could return them.

Since no one thinks to use leather any longer on sneakers (I guess the shoes will last to long and be comfortable.) the man made materials used are subpar compaired to what they used to be back when Levis were saying "Quality never goes out style.". Since quality is now out of style. Shoe manufacturers followed right behind them and now only good show is ahh... Is there a good show? Even Jordans are pleather.

Other than them being the colors that say “Me” lol these shoes are great. A bit stiff @ first but that’s easy to take care of by breaking them in. I read previous comments saying these shows run small so I am glad I found that helpful because if I didn’t I would be returning them. I’m a size 10 1/2 so I upgraded to a 11 & they fit just fine. Little big but that’s ok. Comfortable still & great with exercise. Just keep in mind Puma sneakers do tend to run small so I always go at least half up from ur original shoe size. Just my opinion. 5 stars & value for $$ is well worth it

title: Mesh Sneakers for Women - Non Slip, Slip On, Sock Sneakers - Light Weight, Air Cushion Running, Work Shoes
Customer_say: Customers find these walking shoes comfortable with thick insoles and great arch support that helps with low back pain. The shoes are lightweight and nice-looking, with one customer noting they're perfect for high arches. While some customers find them easy to slip on, others struggle to put them on. The fit receives mixed feedback, with some saying they run big while others find them too wide.

Review.review: Early review:  They arrived last night in a plastic bag not marked with a string or label like most new shoes.They are nice looking and I love the material. I work on my feet and have a spur on my heel that irritates my achilleas. I need a show with a raised heel but also extreme comfort to the soles. Recently a ganglion cyst formed on the top of my foot. It goes down when I am not wearing my comfortable but boxy Clogs work shoes.I needed something to match the comfort of my expensive Clogs but soft enough not to irritate the cyst on the top of my feet that was rubbing against the rubber rib eight hours a day. The price was a fourth of the price of the average professional work shoe.The Shoe came with a terrible insert and I changed them at once. They were lumpy, thin foam. The shoe fits snug around the toes but like a sock to the top of your feet. If you want to wear socks go up a half to a whole size.They fit and feel like wearing swimming socks with thick rubber soles of a running shoe.I wore them out for a few hours and decided thin socks would be needed due to sweaty feet without socks. One review said they were over hot. I did not find them so. A few reviews said they cramped the toes  and it was true at first, but not too bad. A co worker purchased the same shoes said she found the toes cramped but they took form later and is not longer an issue.I am on my feet for 8 hours straight and  10-18k steps a shift. Comfort is required. After my first night wearing them I love them. My toes were a bit tight at first but not too much. I never felt discomfort. I love the lift and the running shoes soles. It is like having the best of both worlds in socks across the top and strong soles together with a pleasant look. I strongly recommend these shoes and have to my co workers.On an extra note after a few days of wearing the shoes, the toes no longer feel tight.  I will be buying more colors to wear casually in place of my other tennis shoes.

Very unimpressed with packaging since I thought shoes would come in a box, instead they were just wrapped together in plastic wrap.  They did look new though so i unwrapped and WOW!  When I put them on, I didnt take them off until I went to bed.  They were so incredibly comfortable.  I have very fussy feet and so it’s often times hard to find comfortable shoes for being on my feet or walking for long distances or several hours.  These are very light weight and should keep my feet cool enough in the  summer heat.  Since they do not have lacees, i wondered if my feet would be secure enough and stay in place, and they do.  My right foot pronates inward and this shoe seems to have the right support to keep my feet well aligned.  I highly recommend,

I have purchased two pairs of these shoes and both are wearable.On the first walk, I found the soles of shoes were slippery but after about five minutes they became resistant and have good traction on tile, carpet and sidewalks.Another reviewer stated that the shoes do not slip on easily and I agree.  They are hard to get on.  The sole thickening is 2.1 inch at the heel which makes it difficult to slip you heel in with having to tug on the back to pull them in position.  I don't mind because once they are on, they feel good and comfortable.  I wear them without socks all day with no discomfort.  They are very easy to get off.I wash mine after every use by removing the inner cushion and tossing them in the washer.  I place them outside to dry.  I have tried many of the other slip on walking shoes and for the price, I like these the best.

I  purchased these sneakers because I wanted my 94 year young parent to not have to fight with getting shoes on and tieing them up. These are the perfect shoe and she says the are very comfortable, plus they look good on. I highly recommend to anyone who wants the ease of putting on and no worries about untied laces. Material is sweater like and looks rich in this color.

I was excited to get some slip-on shoes since Sketchers decided to stop making their VERY nice Leather slip-on shoes. When I received these new shoes I ordered 3 of them since my size sells out fast. Two of the pairs this one was only in a plastic bag no shoe box. I was told they would be received all together in one order, NOPE; one pair came one day and so on! Hate it when that happens!I put the shoes on and they were larger than the normal 5.5 size. Your foot slipped forward and backwards in the shoe when walking, and then something odd happened. I turned a corner and my foot slipped right over the side of the shoe with damn near breaking my ankle. It shook me so bad that after that incident you had to be real conscious of foot placement for each foot. Making sure you carefully was square on the floor. My ankle still hurts and I’m so glad I didn’t fall with just having a total shoulder replacement. This shoe absolutely has NO ANKLE support! If you are light on your feet, have a hip replacement or shoulder replacement these shoes are NOT for you. They don’t keep your feet from getting wet either. I wanted them as I can use only one arm to put shoes on. BUT who wants to wear them outside in the rain and get wet feet. The soles are made of “HARD PLASTIC” and they also slip on the carpet and floors. The inside of the shoe is also slick; they do however have good padding in them with arch support. Terrible design! Loved the Leather Sketchers Slip-On shoes with arch support and padding, but hate this bad yarn design. Just VERY disappointed! My doctor gave them a very bad review too! In the photo you can see the heal slips right over the side of the shoe.

When I first tried these shoes in they felt so comfy and lightweight. However after a day or two I realized that they aren’t comfortable after more than a short distance.They have minimal support on the sides and ankle so beware if you have ankle issues.

title: PUMA Unisex-Child Attacanto Indoor Training Soccer Shoe
Customer_say: Customers find these indoor soccer shoes to be of good quality, particularly suitable for futsal, and appreciate their durability, with one customer noting they lasted through an entire indoor soccer season. They are comfortable, stylish, and come in appealing colors, offering great value for money. Customers like the fit, with one mentioning they work well on both hard court and indoor turf surfaces.

Review.review: The PUMA Attacanto Indoor Training Sneakers are an absolute game-changer for my kid’s training sessions! From the moment we got them, I could tell these shoes were built for both performance and style.First off, the Electric Peppermint Black colorway is amazing—bright and bold, but not too flashy, and it definitely stands out. My child loves how they look, and they’ve received so many compliments! The sleek design with a pop of color makes them perfect for both indoor training and casual wear.In terms of comfort, these sneakers are top-notch. The fit is true to size, and the shoes offer excellent support. The cushioned insole and breathable upper keep their feet comfortable even after hours of movement, whether they’re on the court or just running around. The rubber sole provides great grip, so no slipping during quick pivots or sprints.I also love how versatile they are. These sneakers are built to handle a range of indoor sports, from basketball to training drills. And they hold up really well, even with regular wear. My child says they feel light and responsive, which is great for agility.Overall, the PUMA Attacanto sneakers are a fantastic investment. They’re stylish, durable, and offer the perfect balance of comfort and performance for active kids. Highly recommend!

These PUMA Kids' Attacanto Indoor Training Soccer Shoes have been great for my daughter! She’s been wearing them for the past few months, and they’ve held up really well. The fit is comfortable, the grip is solid, and they provide great support for indoor play.For the price, they’re a great value, and I’ll definitely be buying them again when she needs a new pair. Highly recommend for any young soccer player! ⚽👏

Review.review: good ones ❤️

Super stylish and sleek, but the hook and loop closures are rather small. I’m happy the shoes stretched a bit the more I wear them. They’re a little noisy, though —- they sound like the dress shoes I wore in the service. They’re easy to wipe off to keep them looking good. I enjoy them quite a bit… enough to consider a second pair.

These make great cycling shoes, and I don’t bike long-distance without them!  A few things to note…  Buy one size larger, this shoe comes in smaller than the shoe size.  I wear a size eleven and this size twelve fits perfectly.  My first pair of Puma track/driving shows four years ago.  My first pair of Puma driving shoes lasted for four years of cycling before they started to fall apart.  For cycling (or driving) these shoes are really comfortable, fit great, have great quality, and the Velcro closures solve the only problem I had with my old Puma's - the shoelaces get caught in the bike gears.  I highly recommend this shoe to cyclists and drivers.Last notes…  These are not shoes for anything other than short walking distances – they aren’t designed for walking, they’re designed for driving while seated, and in my case and others cycling while sitting.  And finally, the soles of this shoe can be very slippery when wet so take care.

I use these shoes strictly for driving as I have a long commute and sometimes drive a windy road. They work very well for that reason, which is why I recommend these shoes for utility purposes only (driving/sports). I do NOT recommend for casual wearing at all. I only walk in these shoes for short distances and can tell my feet would hurt if I wore them all day. Also, the shoes would fit tight even with no show socks. I don't wear socks when wearing them.  So if you are looking for shoes to go with an outfit, don't buy these. But if your plans are to wear them for driving or some specific sport, these are good for the price.

Was looking for sim racing shoes on a budget. Looked into water shoes but was put off by the many reviews stating the soles were too soft. Saw these and figured, for $27 what the hell. I was previously using regular shoes that would occasionally cause me to press the accelerator while braking because of how wide they were. These taper towards the front which completely eliminated the accidental accelerator presses. The sole is stiff enough to give you great feel and they’re very light. They’re not as breathable as I’d like them to be but they’re not bad. I’ve worn them for several hours and never found them to be uncomfortable. If you’re looking for budget sim racing shoes, I’d highly recommend these. They even look the part! Well, time to get back to Forza, or GT7, or iRacing, whichever one doesn’t trigger you.

title: PUMA Men's Club Ii Era Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable, with one noting the thick insoles, and appreciate their quality, with one highlighting the quality knitting on the leather. Review.review: I recently purchased the PUMA Club II Era sneakers, and they've quickly become my go-to pair for daily wear. The combination of leather and suede in the upper gives them a sleek, retro-inspired look that pairs well with various outfits. The SoftFoam+ sockliner provides excellent cushioning, making them comfortable for extended periods of walking or standing.The fit is true to size, but if you have wider feet, you might consider going half a size up, as they have a slightly narrow profile. The rubber outsole offers good traction, and the overall construction feels durable and well-made.Overall, these sneakers strike a perfect balance between style and comfort. Whether you're dressing up or keeping it casual, the PUMA Club II Era is a versatile choice that doesn't disappoint.

title: PUMA Men's Attacanto Indoor Trainer Soccer Shoe Sneaker
Customer_say: Customers find these soccer shoes to be of great quality, with beautiful colors and good grip. They are comfortable and worth the $25 price tag. The fit and sizing receive mixed feedback - while some say they fit great, others find them too tight. The durability is also mixed, with customers noting they are not flimsy, though one customer reports issues with the sole separating from the upper.

Review.review: The material of the boot itself is thin in a good way. It feels one with my foot since it's a snug fit. The sole is thin so you feel close to the ground, but absolutely not flimsy. It's a full rubber sole and plenty grippy and flexible.They do run small and narrow, but I prefer tight and snug for soccer cleats because I make better and more reliable/predictable contact with the ball, and my feet stay planted and don't move within the shoe.Running shoes I size like regular shoes but lace them tight and snug. Soccer cleats I size them small and tight so that the boot/shoe itself is snug and not forced by laces which is difficult to tighten and also makes for pressure points...snug cleats don't cause pressure points and are easily snug without relying so much on laces, for me. These are great and well worth the $25!!I wear a 12 in Mizuno andSaucony running shoes, and 12 in these Pumas feels pretty damn tight on me on width and length. 12.5 may be better and I could probably wear them all day, but it'd still be unusually snug on the width...but that'd be good for soccer. The 12s on me I wore for 4 hours and my feet weren't hurting at all, but when I took them off, I enjoyed the feeling of them being off. My toes are pretty much at the very end of the toe box on these 12s, yet I have a comfortable gap on my running shoes. I'm keeping the 12s because they're so smug and great. I'll probably buy longer laces so I can loosen them more easily without difficult tying.I'm not regretting my purchase at all, just sharing my experience.
Great shoes.  A little bit of a tight fit though.

Shorter and way more narrow than expected. Typically I wear a 9.5 but these seemed like I needed 10.5 and the ey were so narrow it felt like I was walking on the out side of the shoe. Nice design good quality. Just too small
Good feeling, adequate to my feet

I have been a loyal fan of Puma sneakers for years, appreciating their consistent fit and comfort across various styles. However, my recent experience with a new pair in men's size 10.5, a size I've comfortably worn in other Puma styles, left me notably disappointed. These sneakers felt unusually tight and seemed to be undersized, a stark contrast to the reliable sizing I've come to expect from the brand.Initially, I held onto the hope that the shoes would stretch and conform to my feet after a period of breaking in. This optimism led me to keep the sneakers past the point of return. Regrettably, they did not improve in fit as I had hoped, which ultimately rendered them unwearable for me. Acknowledging my misjudgment in not returning them immediately, I've decided to donate the shoes to Goodwill.This experience serves as a reminder of the variability that can occur in manufacturing and the importance of addressing fit issues promptly. While this has been a setback in my history with Puma, it also highlights the need for careful consideration when trying new styles, even from brands we know and trust.

title: Reebok Mens Energen Lux
Customer_say: Customers find these shoes comfortable, lightweight, and true to size, with good looks and value for money. They appreciate the fit, with one customer noting they're not too wide or narrow. The durability receives mixed feedback - while some customers report great durability, others mention that the soles wear out fast.

Review.review: I've been wearing the Reebok Energen Lux shoes for over a month, and I'm genuinely impressed by their performance as an all-day, every-day shoe. I needed something that could handle both short gym sessions and constant wear—from morning errands to evening walks—and these have quickly become my go-to pair.What truly stands out is the enduring support. Many comfortable shoes feel great on day one but start to flatten out after a couple of weeks. These Energen Lux shoes have successfully retained their cushion and responsiveness, even with continuous daily use. The mid-sole provides a fantastic blend of softness for comfort and firmness for stability, which is essential for keeping feet and joints happy when you're on your feet for hours.The fit is true to size, and the upper mesh material is breathable without feeling flimsy. The construction is solid, showing no premature signs of wear on the sole or the upper fabric, which speaks volumes about their quality at this price point.If you are looking for a highly versatile, comfortable, and reliable sneaker that can transition effortlessly from a light workout shoe to a shoe you wear daily without losing its supportive feel, I highly recommend the Reebok Energen Lux. Fantastic value and performance.

I love these tennis shoes. I was introduced to Brooks tennis shoes years ago, when I worked in the medical field; I fell in LOVE with my brooks, but certainly not the price tag. I saw these advertised on Amazon when searching for a new pair of tennis shoes, and as an avid purple lover, I just had to have these! I love the color; they’re not too bright and not too dark, which means I can wear these with practically anything. I ordered these in a 6.5, since I typically wear a size 6.5-7. I will admit that they were a little tighter on the top. I’m also 8 months pregnant, so I assumed it was from water retention, because they fit perfectly on other days. Although they don’t fit like my Brooks, they’re still very comfortable! Since I’m in the final stages of my pregnancy, I still try to workout as much as I can; so far, they’ve held up pretty well! Which, for $70, they should last awhile! They’re very comfortable, durable, and lightweight, which are all very important to me when considering a shoe, especially since I practically live in them. I’ve had them for a few months now, and although I haven’t worn them enough to break them in, I have worn them enough times to give this honest review! They haven’t left any blisters, and my feet didn’t hurt while I adjusted to them. Overall, I’d rate these tennis shoes a 4/5 for comfort, support, and functionality.

title: Reebok Nano X5 Mens Shoes, Cross Training and Light Running Sneakers for Men
Customer_say: Customers find these gym shoes superior in quality, comfortable, and effective for workouts, with one customer noting they're great for leg days at the gym. The shoes receive positive feedback for their style, support, and fit. Customers disagree on the sizing, with some reporting the shoes are too small and too short.

Review.review: Solid cross trainers for people with a lifting focus. Flat sole, way less toe spring than many other cross trainers. Wider toe box as well. Result is a more stable shoe with excellent ground contact. Not anchors or lifted like a lifting shoe and excellent side grip which gives it good lateral movement as well.Overall a stylish unicorn of a shoe that meets several needs of both weightlifting and aerobic activity.Obviously this all has trade-offs. Less toe spring and wider box means not as good of a running shoe as some others. Less heel and more flexible lateral movement means not a perfect squat shoe, but this is my pick for a weight lifter focused cross trainer that wants to fit in some cardio and calisthenics in the same workout without changing shoes.
I've never worn a more comfortable gym shoe! I take them on walks and short runs too but just wearing them out for the day and in the gym feels great. They fit perfectly and look very nice!

I really love these shoes. Very lightweight with solid support. I do mostly CrossFit which means running, barbell work and gymnastics. It is perfect for workouts that involve a little bit of each. I wouldn’t do heavy squats or Olympic lifts in them but they work for lighter workouts I don’t want to wear my lifters for. I wouldn’t run a marathon with them but I prefer them if I have to run intervals while also incorporating barbell work.

This version is shorter and narrower. Ordered size 12.5 per my last X1 pair and these do not fit. Typical of Reebok to modify sizing every iteration of the Nano. Frustrating because the screaming deal I got on this pair is more than twice the price for size 13.

title: Reebok Men's Walk Ultra 7 DMX Max Walking Sneakers
Customer_say: Customers find these walking shoes comfortable, well-designed, and good value for money, with great arch support that's particularly suitable for older feet. The fit receives mixed feedback, with some finding them good while others say they're too narrow. Moreover, durability is also mixed, with some saying they're durable for walking or working while others report them falling apart. Additionally, customers note that the shoes squeak like crazy.

Review.review: Ok, these shoes are stellar; comfortable, supportive and with the dependability of genuine leather. The (Ortholite) insoles are amazing and the Moving Air technology seems to work really well. My pair fit to perfection and look splendid. That they reached me fast via the incomparable Amazon experience is just gravy, as is the surprisingly reasonable price. Dance on, Reebok.
He really liked them  said they were very comfortable.

I bought these sneakers to replace a sub-$30.00 pair of Kirkland sneakers that I got at Costco five or six years ago.  That's a long time for a walking sneaker, but those things refused to die.  They were some of the best money that I ever spent on footwear.  They've been pretty much indestructible, and they had the most comfortable insoles that I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing.  I've replaced the insoles a couple of times, but now the sneakers are looking long in the tooth.  Time for a new pair.  Unfortunately, it seems they don't make those particular sneakers anymore.  If they do, I can't find them.After looking over Amazon, I found these.  I'm not interested in any "fashion forward" screwball looking sneakers.  I just want I nice regular pair of sneakers at a reasonable price.  I've had pretty good luck buying sneakers online.  I order a size twelve and they fit without issue.  I was a little surprised when I first tried these sneakers on and they felt a little snug.  I like a snug sneaker, but these almost felt undersized.  I'm strictly talking about the width here.  Length wise they're fine.  I've been wearing them for over a week now, and they are definitely starting to break in.  They do feel like they run a little on the snug side, so if you like your sneakers roomy, you may want to consider going up half a size.Pros:- These were listed at $48.00 when I ordered them.  That's a good deal.  Assuming they hold up.- They feel well made and appear to be good quality.  (I'll revisit this after I've had them for awhile.)- They look good.  Of course, this is a matter of taste, but I think they look really nice.Cons:- They're a little on the snug side.  Okay by me, you might feel differently.- Short tongue.  Should be 1/2" to 1" longer.How they feel on your feet is a matter of taste.  These are getting more comfortable as I where them.  That's a good thing.  I like a snug fit, because I feel that it gives me more support.  You may feel otherwise.  I wish the soles were a little wider for more lateral stability.  This is a matter of individual preference.  The insoles are the soft and spongy type.  They provide comfort, but not much support.  I like them, but I don't think they'll last very long.  Overall, I'm happy with these so far.  If they hold up, I'll probably come back and up the rating to five stars.
My opinion these are the best walkers on the market. Great fit and support. This is my 2nd pair, wore the first ones out!

The shoes are very comfortable.  This is my go-to for work shoes because they work well with my messed up feet.  They accommodate the bunions on the outside of my foot, my messed-up pinky toe, and have good heel cushion.

I've been ordering the same shoes (with some slight model variations) for work from the same manufacturer for years. I'll usually wear them until the seams come apart or the tread wears out. The tread seemed to wear out pretty fast with the last couple pairs I bought, so I thought I'd try these instead.Got them yesterday and put them on today. Nice looking shoe. I'm worried about glue breaking down and the seam eventually  coming apart around the toe, but I guess that may or may not happen- will update. I usually order a wide shoe but that wasn't avail for this shoe, so they fit kind of snug. Not too snug though- definitely workable and I'm sure they'll loosen up as I break them in. Lots of cushioning. In fact, they're almost bouncy.Only issue out of the box is they are incredibly noisy. They squeak and creek with every movement. On both hard and soft surfaces, as well as wet and dry surfaces.  Mostly from the arch and heel area. And it's LOUD. I can't remember ever having shoes this noisy. I really hope they get less noisy as I wear them.UPDATE: So over 3 weeks later, the left shoe has quieted down a lot. It's still a little noisy though. The right shoe has shown no change. It sounds like a duck with each step I take, and it's quite loud. Inside, outside, wet, dry, hard surface or soft, this shoe is LOUD.  It's the rubber tread/sole on the bottom of the shoe that makes the noise. I'm almost 60 and I've never had shoes with this type of issue before. I'm very disappointed that a major brand like Reebok uses such crappy materials in their product. I WILL NOT be purchasing from Reebok again.UPDATE 2: So here it is 2 months later, and the right shoe is still loud as heck. It's the tread and the way it moves when I walk. It like rubs up against itself somewhere and makes that squeaking sound. I wear the shoes to work 6 days/week so you'd think it would have stopped by now. The other day it was raining and these shoes got soaked. They were too wet to wear the next day so I wore my back-ups, which are my previous pair by another brand. I was immediately reminded how nice it was to walk without loud noises coming from my shoes. That's it. I'm throwing these away and ordering a pair of my regular brand. will not buy these again.

Quality just OK. Not as good as previous models. Wears quickly inside the back heel and has an annoying squeak when walking. But I guess, for the price, it's OK. Functions well as a light and comfortable walking shoe.
